loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
This is Josie, age 43, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is the wife of her husband Wilfredo, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josie operates a foam/pillow manufacturing business. Her products are foam for beds and pillows. They assemble foam and pillows out of materials she buys from the factory. They prepare the bed and pillowcases and assemble them with the foam materials. She sells her products directly to the market and the local community. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.

Josie hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Tserentogtoh

texts.en:
Tserentogtoh is 35 years old and lives with his two sons and wife in a ger in Ovorhangai province of Mongolia. His wife works as a tailor at the local fashion salon. His eldest son is a high school student. The youngest son attends the local kindergarten. 

Tserentogtoh started his business back in 2004 by serving (transporting) people by motorcycle. In 2006, he bought his car and became a taxi driver ever since. He has 7 years of work experience. He's already made a regular client base. At the same time, he provides a call-taxi service. 

Within 2011, he took three loans from XacBank and bought furniture sets to his house. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy petrol and repair his car to increase his capital turnover.

loans.use: To buy petrol and repair his car

loans.name: Boldukan's Group

texts.en:
Boldukan is the leader of this group. She is 51 and married to a turner (a person who works with a lathe). Together with her husband, Boldukan has raised a daughter and a son. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family; the son studies at school in the 8th grade.

Four years ago, with an initial investment of 5700 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS), Boldukan purchased two lambs for breeding. She sells dairy products, earning about 5000 soms per month. She plans to use the loan to purchase three more livestock animals for breeding. In the future, she wants to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Idrissa is 52 years old and married with 8 children, aged 11 to 25.  Six children are currently attending school.

Idrissa runs a provision-and-assorted-foodstuffs store in Goderich, a neighborhood in Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone.  He has owned this business for 4 years and sells batteries, sugar, mayonnaise, soft drinks, rubber drinks, and tea leaves. He also earns income from a small-scale fishing boat at sea. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation.

Idrissa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and assorted foodstuffs. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he plans to build a house and open another branch of his store.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as soft drinks, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a mother of five, all of whom are now adults save for the last two. She is aged 53 and has been in farming for 30 years. She currently produces potatoes, maize, beans and wheat, which she sells to the local market in her home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya. Florence also runs a cereals retail business to supplement her farming income.
Florence has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy income will help her educate her children. She plans to buy two more dairy cows in future to enable her to enjoy the economies of scale.
Florence states that the high cost of dairy feeds and unreliable rainfall are posing a threat to her business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy piles of firewood for resale, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is aged 29 and married with one child aged four. He has been in active farming for seven years and produces beans, maize, potatoes and wheat for the local market and middlemen. He earns additional income from plowing others farmers' farms.
Julius has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income will provide for his family's basic needs and improve their living standards. He reiterates that dairy farming is currently lucrative and he looks forward to buying two more dairy cows to earn a better income.
However, Julius notes that animal diseases are a challenge to farmers. He commends Juhudi Kilimo services and notes that they are very fast.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 48, married, and has three children between 24 and 14, with the youngest still schooling. He has been in farming for 31 years in Nkubu, Central Kenya producing and selling potatoes, beans, maize and wheat for the local market. 

Shadrack has made a loan request of 52,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the additional income to boost his cereals retail business as well as build a modern dairy unit for his cows. He adds that his family's living standards will also be improved. 

He cites pests as the greatest threat to farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase his retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 51-year-old married man. He is the father of two children whom he describes as his whole life. 

Samer has owned a grocery store since 2007, which is his only source of income. He works hard to cover all his family's expenses and at the same time support his business. 

Samer is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to pay for his son's university tuition, since he believes that an education is the most important thing to provide to his children. 

Samer hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can, to keep on providing his customers and family the best they deserve.

loans.use: To pay for his son's university expenses

loans.name: Larkoh United Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the "Larkoh" group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Leone (SLL) each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Yayah is the leader of this group. Born in Magburaka town, Yayah is married to a businesswoman and they have four children–two are in primary school, one is in secondary, and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. 

Yayah is a driver and has been in this profession for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, rice, groundnuts, etc. in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables and onions.

loans.name: Surma's Group

texts.en:
Surma is the leader of this group. She is 57 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family, the first son works in construction, and the younger son works in a car repairing center. Four years ago with an initial investment of 10000 KGS, Surma opened a grocery store. She earns about 3000 KGS per month. With the profits gained from the business, Surma was able to purchase three cows and ten sheep. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase beverages, macaroni, and oil, etc. In the future, she is planning to start building a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, macaroni, and oil.

loans.name: Pan Sellers Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in the village of Kafe, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 52 years old. Married to a businessman, Kadiatu has three children – two in secondary school and one in college.

For 30 years now, Kadiatu has been selling dishes, plastic bowls, knives, cups, spoons, etc. This is not the first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have benefited from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of previous SMT/Kiva lenders loan, they have been able to expand their respective businesses, make better profit, and provide support to their children. 

With this new loan, they are going to further expand their businesses. Kadiatu is going to use her share of the loan to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current items.

loans.use: to buy dishes, plastic bowls, knives, cups, spoons, etc. and items in bulk.

loans.name: Ulfatkan's Group

texts.en:
Ulfatkan is the leader of this group. She is 54, and married to farmer who is also engaged in cattle breeding. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and two daughters. The son helps with housework, and the daughters are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn additional money for the family, Ulfatkan sells salads. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase products for preparing salads. In the future, she wants to see her son get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase products for preparing salads.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, green grams, and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, green grams, and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Sargis

texts.ru:
Саргису 41 год, он родился и вырос деревне Шакаох (Shikahogh). После окончания Шикаохской сельской школы, Саргис поступил в Капанский автодорожный техникум.
Деревня, в которой проживает Саргис, является пограничным населенным пунктом, и в период Нагорно-Карабахского конфликта Саргис принимал участие в обороне своей деревни. Он живет один и получает военную пенсию.  
С 2010 г. Саргис занимается продажей продовольственных товаров. Товары он закупает в городе Капане еженедельно и работает без выходных. 
Одновременно с частной предпринимательской деятельностью, Саргис занимается сельским хозяйством. На своей ферме он разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, выращивает овощи. А небольшой участок собственной земли он использует как пастбище для своих коров. Скупщики с Капанского городского рынка покупают у Саргиса говядину, молоко, яйца и овощи и продают их на рынке. Сельским хозяйством Саргис занимается в утренние и вечерние часы. 
Саргис намеревается приобрести гусеничный трактор и работать на нем по найму в период пахоты. Для этого ему необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм.
texts.en:
Sargis is forty-one years old, and he was born and raised in the village of Shikahogh. After graduating from a local school, he entered Kapan College as a student. Shikahogh is a border town and, during the Nagorno-Karaback conflict, Sargis was an active member of his village's defense. He lives alone and receives a military pension. 

In 2010, Sargis began the sale of groceries. He buys them in the city of Kapan and works without holidays. Additionally, he works morning's and evening's on his farm. Sargis breeds livestock, chickens and grows vegetables. His small plot of land is used as pasture for his cows. Buyers from Kapan's market purchase beef, milk, eggs and vegetables from him for resale on the market. 

Sargis plans to buy a caterpillar tractor and find work during the plowing season. He's asking for a loan of 1,000,000 drams.

loans.use: To buy a caterpillar tractor

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 34 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 16. She runs a provisions and assorted drink store in Goderich, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of 4 relatives as well as their immediate families.

Ramatu has owned this business for 7 years and sells soft drinks, bag sugar, sardine cartons, butter, and stout crates at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation and storage of drinks.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and assorted drinks. Ramatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her to continue to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open more branches and invest in another business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a clothes-selling business. She sells clothes in a shop and from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the 20000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of babies clothes, ladies clothes and toys. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of babies clothes, ladies clothes and toys.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane rents out wedding dresses. Gayane would like to increase the number and the variety of dresses for the coming high season, as it is very popular in Armenia to have weddings in autumn. With the help of this loan, Gayane will increase her business income and develop her business further. Gayane dreams of opening a new trading booth in the future.

loans.use: to pay for wedding dresses to rent out.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta keeps livestock and cultivates land. She would like to cultivate more land. With the requested loan Julieta plans to purchase fertilizer and fodder. With the loan's help Julieta will cultivate the land successfully, get a good harvest and increase her income. This will allow her to insure sustainable living conditions for her family. Julieta lives together with her son and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, tomatoes and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Sorie is 46 years old and married with six children, ages six to 28. Three of his children are currently attending school. He also takes care of four relatives.

For the past twenty years Sorie has run a used clothing store in Kissy near Freetown in which he sells both clothes and bags. He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Sorie has requested a loan of 4,000,000 SLL through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more used clothing and bags to sell. He says that this loan will help him increase his income.

In the future Sorie would like to expand his business and also become a supplier.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing and bags to sell.

loans.name: Zabel

texts.en:
Zabel trades in clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Retail is the family's main source of income and it is barely enough to cover the daily costs. Zabel would like to increase the clothing variety and expand her business. 

With the requested loan Zabel plans to purchase new clothing stock.  Zabel will increase her income and insure a brighter future for her family. Zabel lives together with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is fifty years old and married with three children aged fourteen to 25. He also takes care of two relatives.

For the past twenty years John has run a business in Kissy, a neighborhood in Freetown, where he rents and sells movie discs and tapes. He also earns income from renting out a house. John’s main challenge to his business is price inflation.

John has requested this 4,000,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more movie discs and tapes to sell. He says that the extra income will help him increase his savings massively.

In the future John would like to import movie discs and tapes.

loans.use: to purchase more movie discs and tapes to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit keeps livestock and has an orchard. Anahit would like to develop farming, for which she needs some financial investment. With the requested loan Anahit plans to purchase livestock. Farm development will allow Anahit improve her family's living conditions. Anahit lives together with her mother and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has had a food vendor business for eight years now. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees and increase her food stock and has paid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her food stock and pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with his loan group "Kisiwani", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her food stock and pay school fees.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, tomatoes and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, tomatoes and wheat flour.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 and married with three children ages 18, 15 and 9. All of her children are schooling. She has been in farming in her hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya for 16 years. Her farm produce of wheat, maize, beans and potatoes is sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to venture into poultry farming. The milk produced from the dairy cow will go a long way in supplementing family meals.

Catherine, however, says the high costs of farm inputs like fertilizers and poor market prices are causing great harm to farmers. She remains happy with Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy working materials in large quantity in order to produce a larger quantity of mattresses for sale.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun was born in 1978. He lives in Vazashen village with his jobless wife and retired parents. 

Since 1990, Harutyun’s family has been engaged in farming. Now Harutyun is doing the major part of the farm work and thus supporting his family. He breeds goats, a cow and a calf. Harutyun sells goat’s milk and cheese to fellow villagers. Also he grows fruits and vegetables for his family. 

Harutyun intends to develop his farm and he is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy some chickens, rabbits, calves and piglets. Also he will buy fodder for his farm animals. 

This is Harutyn’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some chickens, rabbits, calves, piglets, and fodder.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is aged 53 and  married with three children all schooling.He lives with his family in Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he  has been farming for 15 years and currently produces potatoes, maize, wheat  and beans which are are sold locally.

Moses has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his children  as well as to construct a modern dairy unit. He plans to expand his farming by buying  more parcels of land.

Moses says poor road networks and  unreliable rainfall are a challenge to farmers

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Of The World Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members “Of the World” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in order to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Foday. Foday was born in Magburaka town, about 41 years ago. He is married and has two children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary school. Foday sells petroleum products – petrol, engine oil, etc. He has requested this loan in order to buy more petroleum products for sale.

loans.use: buy more petroleum products for sale.

loans.name: Gregory  Musyoki

texts.en:
Gregory Musyoki is 46 years old and married to Pauline, a business lady. Together they have two kids. His primary business is construction. He has been in the sector for the past three years. His monthly income from the business is 30,000 KES.


  This is his fourth loan with KADET.His previous loans were repaid successfully .The loan will help him buy construction materials. The anticipated profits will help pay fees for his children. His dream is to own a residential building.

loans.use: Buy  blocks and other construction materials.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya and has been in farming for the last 31 years. His farm produces beans, onions, maize, wheat and tomatoes which he sells locally. He is 44 and married and has four children aged between 20 and 2. 

John has requested a loan of 47,250 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will enable him to expand his farming activities and generate more income to educate his children. His focus is to buy land for expansion. 

He adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans are a source of livelihood to many farmers. He still sees insufficient rains as a challenge to farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil and rice at wholesale

loans.name: Selman

texts.en: Selman is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has owned a shoe shop in his town for the past seven years. He always presents the new trends and collections to his customers in order to satisfy their demands. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new shoes. He hopes that the diverse selection of new merchandise will generate good profits and enable him to expand his business even further. He expects that his business sales and income will be increased as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase new shoes

loans.name: Foryirra Group

texts.en:
Yeabu (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yeabu was born in Mayorlow village, on the outskirts of Magburaka town, about 45 years ago. Yeabu is a widow with four children: one is in primary school, two are in secondary school and one is grown-up. Yeabu sells rice, pepper, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Yeabu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Yeabu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy rice, pepper, palm oil, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, palm oil, etc. in larger quantities

loans.name: Adik

texts.en:
Adik was born in 1962. He is married and has two children, a daughter and a son, who are both already married. His daughter lives separately with her family; his son and his family live with Adik.

Adik previously worked as a worker and a builder; he sold shoes as well. But now he and his family have a hothouse and a garden where they grow beans and vegetables for sale, which enables them to support themselves. To increase his farm production, Adik plans to enlarge his hothouse and has thus asked for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD). He also intends to breed pigs on his farm, so he will use part of the loan to buy some piglets.

loans.use: To enlarge his hothouse and to buy piglets

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has operated a hardware business for seven years, having acquired her initial capital from her husband.

Evalyne is requesting the loan to buy nails, iron bars and cement to sell. Her major business hardship is price fluctuation, and her goals are to have another hardware shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy nails, iron bars and cement to sell.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur samba vit au Sénégal. C’est un célibataire  de 32 ans qui évolue dans depuis 5 ans dans le secteur de la couture.  Parallèlement  il pratique la vente de tissus thioups, wax et divers autres.  Il a choisi son activité dans le souci de gagner sa vie étant donné qu’il vit dans une grande maison familiale. Il est membre  d’un des guichets de l’ (U-IMCEC depuis 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus( thioups, wax, etc. ) qu’il compte revendre a sa clientèle. Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de régler ses frais de location de son atelier et  de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Samba, age 32, lives in Senegal. He's single and, for five years, has been working in the dressmaking business. In parallel, he sells dyed fabrics (called "thioups" and "wax") as well as other products.

He chose this business eager to earn a living since he lives in a large family household. He's been a member of UIMCEC since 2011 and is seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 to buy dyed fabrics (thioups, wax, etc) to resell to his clientele. His profits enable him to pay the rent for his workshop and increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy and resell dyed fabrics

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is a 33-year-old married man with two children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his dream is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity. He has been buying and selling produce for 10 years. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,800,000 shillings as capital. His hardships are debtors, price fluctuations and high transport costs. His vision is a well- established produce store plus an educated family. Bright needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 29-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her parents and one sibling. This woman works so hard to be able to satisfy her life's needs and provide her family with extra financial support. She started her career working as a freelance beautician. In parallel, for the past two years, she decided to start running her own business. So she opened a small shop where she put up for sale home appliances. This hard working woman is asking today to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products such as Tupperware, plastic bottles, glasses etc. to reinforce her business and strengthen it. In the future, she hopes to focus on one business in order to centralize her managerial skills in one industry and make good profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as Tupperware, plastic bottles, etc.

loans.name: Ndiande

texts.fr: Madame Ndiande est une célibataire de 28 ans qui évolue au Sénégal. Elle pratique  en même temps  la vente d’habits déjà confectionnés. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans cette activité qu’elle a choisie pour éviter de rester inactive. Ses moments les plus favorables sont les veilles de fête  ou elle parvient a confectionner beaucoup d’habits. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine a coudre. Son objectif est de démarrer la confection d’habits pour enfants  et accroitre ses bénéfices
texts.en:
Ndiande, age 28 is single and lives in Senegal. She sells ready-to-wear clothing. She chose this business to avoid staying inactive, and has three years of experience in this field. Her favorite moments are the days leading to a holiday, when she manages to make a lot of clothes.

She's been a member of UIMCEC since 2010, and she's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, intended to buy a sewing machine. Her goal is to start making children's clothing and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a 37-year-old single mother of two children aged 14 and 9. They live in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been the sole breadwinner. For six years, she has been operating a drugstore. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Winfred needs the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past seven years, Martin has operated a motorcycle business. The borrowers photo was taken at the town center in front of a car. He operates both from home and at the market. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season. He dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), Martin plans to purchase spare parts, oil, and lubricants to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, oil, and lubricants to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo, a married man with two children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business from home. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business, and dreams of establishing a grocery shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, he wants to purchase spare parts and oil to service his motorcycle with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and oil to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a married man with two children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Francis has owned a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from the market with neighbors and passersby as his potential customers. He faces the major challenges of seasonality and theft in his business, and dreams of establishing a spare parts shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, Francis wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts, oil and lubricants with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts, oil and lubricants.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en:
Kaingu is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past five years, Kaingu has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business at the market. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate. He dreams of purchasing two more motorcycles and establishing a spare-parts shop in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he plans to purchase motorcycle spare parts for servicing his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for servicing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es empleado y realiza trabajos de limpieza en una oficina de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción del alcantarillado de su casa. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz;  es divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Alberto is employed cleaning an office in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies to repair his house’s sewage system.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  He’s divorced and has two children.  This is the first time the client has gotten an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El señor Oscar es Chofer; está afiliado en un sindicado de transportes. Además, tiene una tienda de abarrotes para su esposa. El crédito lo necesita para el aumento de capital compra de abarrotes (arroz, fideo, azúcar, etc.) y dulces, pues la tienda es la fuente de ingresos que tiene su esposa para ayudar a mantener  a su familia. Es casado, no tiene hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Oscar is a driver affiliated to a transportation syndicate.  Besides, he has a grocery store for his wife.  He needs the loan to increase capital purchasing groceries (rice, noodles, sugar, etc.) and candy because the store is his wife’s source of income that helps support the family.  He’s married and has no children and lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the second time he’s requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his wife's store.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a firewood-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a firewood stall to sell in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood and pay for transport.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to his family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a charcoal-selling stall in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Herbalife products.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 33 years old. He is married with two children between two and five years old. He sells various goods such as soft drinks, biscuits, lotions, etc and he has three years of experience in this business. He works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except Sunday.

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as soft drinks, biscuits, lotions, sugar, rice, salt etc for sale. Once his business is expanded, Claude hopes to reinvest in this business and to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, biscuits, lotions, etc to sell.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El señor Ángel es empleado en la federación de municipios de Bolivia; trabaja como coordinador de autonomías. El crédito lo requiere para pagar un diplomado en derecho administrativo, pues es muy importante para el trabajo que actualmente realiza. Vive en  alquiler en una casa la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero  y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Ángel is employed by the Bolivian Federation of Municipalities; he works as an Autonomous Regions Coordinator.  He needs the loan to pay for an advanced course in Administrative Law because it’s very important for the work he’s currently doing.  He lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Cota Cota zone.  He’s single and has no children.

loans.use: to pay for an advanced course in Administrative Law.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do some plumbing, purchase pipes and pay labour charges.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with five children, two boys and three girls. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing.

Jane has operated a food-stall business for more than ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Competition is a major business challenge for her. She dreams of building real estate houses in the future.

With a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she plans to purchase iron sheets to roof her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire and pay more laborers to help him make bricks

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, a married father of two boys and a girl, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For over ten years, Julius has operated a sculpture-making business, selling along the coastline to tourists visiting Mombasa for holidays. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business, and dreams of purchasing plots of land to build houses in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, with a loan Kshs 30,000 Julius wants to purchase wood for making sculptures for sale.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making sculptures for sale.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, one boy and one girl. One of her children attends school while the other one is still young for school. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a bar business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Lydia faces a major challenge of competition from other bar operators in the area. She dreams of owning a house for her family in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase crates of beer and establish a wines and spirits shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and establish a wines and spirits shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's creams.

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen Alexandra tiene 39 años y es madre soltera con dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Trabaja duro para ofrecerles una vida mejor. Al darse cuenta de que no había muchas oportunidades comerciales en su sector, ella fundó su propia tienda. Está trabajando sola en su tienda, diariamente de las 8am hasta las 6pm. Además también trabaja en una escuela. 
Ella solicita este crédito para ampliar su negocio y así ayudar a sus dos hijos a que terminen sus estudios. Su sueño es de terminar su casa durante los próximos cinco años.
texts.en:
Carmen Alexandra is 39 years old; she is a single mother with two children, ages six and two. She works hard to offer them a better life. When Carmen realized that there were not many commercial opportunities in her sector, she started her own store. She works alone in the store every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm, also working in a school sometimes. 

Carmen is applying for this loan to expand her business and, in this way, help her two children finish their studies. Her dream is to finish the building of ehr home during the next five years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and sell it in her store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene una tienda de abarrotes y su esposo es chofer y maneja  un vehiculo propio. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar al por mayor productos como ser arroz, fideo y dulces para surtir su tienda. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Valle Hermoso de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y no tiene hijos. Lourdes es cliente desde el año 2008 y esta es la tercera vez que su préstamo se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes has a grocery store. Her husband is a chauffeur and drives his own vehicle. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk such as rice, noodles, and candy so that she can restock her store. This is the source of income that helps her to cover her expenses. Lourdes lives with her parents in the District of Valle Hermoso in the city of La Paz. She is married and has no children.

Lourdes has been a client since 2008 and this is the third time that her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, candy, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Mwakupha

texts.en:
Mwakupha is a married man with one child who attends school.  They live at their own house which has neither electricity nor piped water.  His monthly expenses are school fees, food and clothing for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Mwakupha faces challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation.  In addition, he has a motorcycle for transport that contributes to his income. He dreams of expanding his retail business in the future.

With the Kshs.20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with 7 children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a grocery shop.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her grocery shop to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs.30,000, she wants to purchase grocery items, sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables and onions in order to increase her stock.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables and onions

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: La señora Ingrid es costurera y se dedica a confeccionar mochilas para toda edad las mismas las comercializa en una de las ferias de la  de la ciudad de La Paz;  su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial, para acelerar el proceso de confección de las mochilas y poder vender más, pues con esta actividad cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Cooperativa  en la Ciudad de El Alto. Ingrid es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010 y esta es la primera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Ingrid is a seamstress who makes satchels for all ages.  She sells her products at a market in the city of La Paz.  Her husband works in the interior of Bolivia.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to speed up the sewing process in making satchels so that she can sell more.  This business enables her to cover the family expenses.  Ingrid lives at the home of her in-laws in the District of Villa Cooperativa in the city of El Alto.  

Ingrid has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the first time her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine for making satchels.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman who has no children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and food for the family.

For the past four years, she has been operating a poultry-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Constance faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with two children who graduated from school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are clothing and food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling clothes to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El señor Felipe trabaja como chofer y su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital para el negocio de su esposa, para que pueda comprar los insumos (arroz, papa, carne, verduras, etc.) al por mayor y tener un mayor margen de ganancia. Felipe y su esposa viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Tunari  en  la ciudad de El Alto y tienen cuatro hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que solicta un crédito a través de Kiva y se encuentra muy contento con los créditos  que se le otorgaron anteriormente.
texts.en:
Sr. Felipe works as a taxi driver while his wife sells food.  The loan he is requesting will be used to increase the capital for his wife’s business.  She plans to buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, meat, vegetables, and other items so that she can increase her profit margin.  Felipe and his wife live in their own home in the District of Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto.  They have four children.  

This is the third time that Felipe has requested a loan through Kiva.  He is very pleased with the previous loans that were granted to him.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, meat, vegetables, and other items for his wife's business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children, both of whom attend school.  They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her monthly expenses are school fees and clothing for the family.

For the past four years, Saumu has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions to neighbors and passersby. Saumu faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing goods in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and having her own shop.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: El señor Richard es chofer y su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa por distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo solicita para incrementar el capital de trabajo de su esposa, pues necesita comprar deportivos para niños y parcas (chamarras con capuchas) pues son artículos que vende mucho y tiene muchos pedidos. Vive en casa alquiler ubicado en la zona de Rio Seco en  la ciudad de El Alto; Richard  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010 y esta es la primera vez que desea que su crédito se canalize a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Richard is a chauffeur while his wife sells clothing at different fairs in the city of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase the operating capital for his wife’s business. She needs to buy children’s sportswear and parkas (hooded jackets) since these products sell well and she has many orders. Richard lives in a rented house in the District of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. He is married and has two children.

Richard has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the first time that his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy children’s sportswear and parkas for his wife's business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora patricia es un cliente antiguo en la institución saco varios créditos en grupo pero ahora saca  créditos individuales, la señora se dedica a la venta de joyas y cosméticos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de La Paz, Ella solicito el crédito para la compra  de joyas por catálogos que le llegan desde México y así poder ofrecer  en diferentes lugares  de la ciudad de La Paz, ella ambula en diferentes lugares como ser la parte  del centro de la ciudad visitando oficinas, su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque tiene que estar en el sol todo el día, su esposo trabaja en una institución publica, ella tiene hijos pequeños que están estudiando en colegio el anhelo de la señora patricia es que sus hijos estén realizados y sean profesionales un día y personas de bien, es una persona muy emprendedora con ganas de superación y de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Patricia is an old client of the institution [Emprender]; she has taken out various group loans, but now she is applying for a personal loan. Patricia works selling jewelry and cosmetics in different parts of the city of La Paz. She is applying for this loan to buy jewelry from several catalogs based in Mexico; she will sell the jewelry in several locations around central La Paz from a moving cart. Her work is difficult, because she has to be out in the sun all day. Her husband works in a public institution, and they have small children who are studying in middle school. Patricia's hope is that one day her children grow up to be accomplished professionals and good people. She is a very hard-working person with a drive to succeed and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth trabaja como enfermera particular y su esposo es chofer. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar mercadería, específicamente variedad de dulces y tener la posibilidad de abrir una tienda de dulces. Vive en casa propia, ubicada en la zona de Villa Huayna Potosí en la ciudad de El Alto; Elizabeth es casada y no tiene hijos . Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008 y se encuentra muy satisfecha con el crédito anterior que se le otorgó a través de Kiva y ahora desea repetir la excelente experiencia por segunda vez.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth works as a private duty nurse while her husband is a chauffeur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, specifically candy, so that she can pursue the possibility of opening a candy store. Elizabeth lives in her own home in the District of Villa Huayna Potosí in the city of El Alto. She is married and has no children.

Elizabeth has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and is very satisfied with her previous Kiva loan. She now wants to repeat her excellent experience for a second time.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of candy so that she can open a candy store.

loans.name: Avaroa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AVAROA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gillermina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de papa y crianza de ganado.

La señora Gillermina  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra alimento para su ganado) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente lo repartirá a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The civil association AVAROA is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer; as part of the Centro Senkata, the group is made up of seven members and is directed by a directive board, headed by Gillermina.  The members of the association work in several different sectors, including: textiles, convenience stores, food sales, potato sales, and livestock.

According to Gillermina, this is the first cycle for which the group is working with Pro Mujer, entering into the partnership by invitation of a promoter. Gillermina currently has a livestock-raising business in which she has worked for several years, taking over the business from her mother.


The loan that Gillermina is applying for is to increase her capital by purchasing feed for her livestock. She will buy the feed in Ceja, and then give it to her animals. This type of work will help her generate the resources to support her family, which includes her husband and their three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the consultancy.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock.

loans.name: Santos Miguel

texts.es:
Santos Miguel es una persona servicial, humilde, comprometida con su trabajo y su familia, es ganadero, tiene 62 años de edad, viudo y padre de cinco hijos y cinco hijas, y reside en la comunidad de Arenales en el municipio de Trojes.

En el año de 1992 Don Santos inició su actividad ganadera comprando dos vacas para cubrir el consumo de leche en su casa. Luego de un tiempo al notar que las vacas que compró le daban la suficiente leche para el consumo en su casa decidió vender la leche que restaba y entonces poco a poco fue comprando una vaca mas hasta llegar a tener un hato ganadero. 

Don Santos realiza todas las actividades conciernientes al cuidado del ganado todos los dias desde muy temprano por la mañana. Parte de su hato ganadero es de engorge y el otro es lechero, asi que a parte de dedicarse a la venta de leche tambien vende carne. 

El prestamo que don Santos esta solicitando lo necesita para mejorar la calidad del pasto de su propiedad y tambien la raza de su ganado con la compra de varios toros y algunos terneros. Su sueño es tener mas de 30 vacas lecheras. 

Don Santos ha tenido tres prestamos en FAMA y ha realizado sus pagos de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Santos Miguel is a helpful, humble person, dedicated to his work and his family. The 62-year-old rancher is a widower and the father of five sons and five daughters. He lives in the Arenales community in Trojes municipality.

In 1992, Santos started working with livestock, buying two cows to cover his family's milk consumption. Later, after noticing that the cows he had bought gave sufficient milk for household consumption, he decided to sell the leftover milk, and bit by bit, went buying more cows until he had a full ranch.

Santos does everything related to the care of his livestock every day, beginning very early in the morning. Part of his herd is beef cattle, and part is dairy cows, so in addition to selling milk, he also sells meat.

The loan that Santos is applying for is in order to improve the quality of the pasture on his property, and also to improve his herd with the purchase of several bulls and calves. His dream is to have more than 30 dairy cows.

Santos has taken out three loans with FAMA, and he has made punctual payments on all his loans.

loans.use: to improve his pasture and purchase bulls and calves.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angélica llega recomendado por sus padres que son clientes D. nuestra institución, ella vive en la casa D. sus padres juntamente con sus dos hijos uno D. ellos en edad escolar y el otro D. tres años, ella es separada,  el papá D. sus hijos le ayuda con víveres. Angélica se dedica a la elaboración D. enaguas y venta D. mantas en pueblos y zonas aledañas D. su casa ella tiene mas pedido cerca a fiestas D. las localidades, en esta oportunidad tiene bastante pedido para una fiesta que se acerca por la zona D. chasquipampa que se llevara acabo en septiembre, ella necesita el crédito para la compra  D. tela en rollos para la confección D. sus enaguas, es una persona joven con ganas D. crecer y D. tener un taller granD. y poder contratar operarios para así mejorar su calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Angélica comes recommended by her parents, who are clients of our institution.  She lives in her parents' home, together with her two children; one of whom is school-age, and the other is three years old.  She is separated, and the father of her children helps her with their living expenses.

Angélica works making petticoats and selling blankets in the villages and areas surrounding her home.  She takes many orders around the time of the festivals in the region.  Currently, she has sufficient orders for an approaching festival in the Chasquipampa area, which takes place in September.

She needs the loan for the purchase of rolls of fabric for making her petticoats.

She is a young woman with goals of growing her business and having a large workshop where she can hire workers, and so improve her entire family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair one of his taxis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wicker furniture and baskets and resell them in eastern Ukraine

loans.name: Jorge Adrian

texts.es:
Jorge soltero sus hijos estudiantes, hombre trabajador sus planes familiares es ofrecerle un mejores condiciones de vida. De profesión mecánico de tornero desde hace un tiempo iniciándolo con apoyo de su padre y hermano. Proyecto ampliar el local para atender más clientes.
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, piedras canteras, ladrillos, puertas, tubos pvc entre otros materiales. Para la construcción de los servicios sanitarios.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al  desarrollo de su negocio y al mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is single and has children who are students. This hardworking gentleman has plans to offer his family better living conditions. He has been a lathe mechanic by profession for quite some time and started in this trade with the help of his father and brother. He intends to expand his workshop so that he can serve more customers.

Jorge will use this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, blocks, quarry stone, bricks, doors, PVC tubes, and other materials so that he can build a toilet facility. He is grateful for the financial support he has received so that he can develop his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a toilet facility.

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.ru:
Иванна замужем, у нее двое детей. Она занимается мелким предпринимательством в своем родном городе Хуст в Закарпатье. При входе на базар в складе арендует торговую точку, где торгует обувью: летом продает тапочки, босоножки и сандалии, а осенью – резиновую обувь. На рынке Иванна не сталкивается с конкуренцией, товар ее всегда пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентская база. Она занимается этим делом уже 5 лет. На данный момент у нее в товаре 35 000 гривен. Прибыль составляет 7 000 гривен.  

Иванне необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы поехать за товаром прямо на обувную фабрику и приобрести партию качественного товара без посредников, тем самым сэкономив средства для бизнеса. Иванна финансово сознательный предприниматель, она всегда рассчитывает затраты и доходы. Кроме того, она очень энергична и любит свое дело, готова вкладывать в него много сил, времени и финансов.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Ivanna is married and she has two children. She does small business in her hometown of Khoost in the Zakarpatiye region. She is renting out a space in the warehouse at the market entrance where she sells shoes: in the summer time she sells sneakers, slingbacks and sandals and in the fall she sells rubber shoes. Ivanna does not have competition on the market, her merchandise is always in demand and she has a client base. She has been in this business for five years. At this time her merchandise is worth 35,000 hrivnas. Her profit is 7,000 hrivnas.

Ivanna needs a loan in the amount of 20,000 hrivnas to take a trip to buy merchandise directly from the shoe factory and buy a batch of quality stuff without middlemen and by that save on business expenses. Ivanna is a financially conscious business woman, she always accounts for her expenses and profits. Besides that she is very energetic and loves her business and ready to invest a lot of her strength, time and finances.

loans.use: to take a trip to buy merchandise straight from the shoe factory and get a batch of quality merchandise without middlemen, and by that save on the business expenses

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: Massiel quien tiene  27 años es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, pertenece al alcom Las Estrellitas D. Carabayllo y tiene el cargo D. Tesorera, se dedica hace dos años a la venta D. prendas D. vestir a pedido, y D. ese modo ayuda a su pareja con los gastos D. la casa. Su meta es poder ser una gran empresaria en este rubro y tener su propio puesto mas adelante.
texts.en:
Massiel is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. She is part of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas D. Carabayllo” (The Little Stars of Carabayllo), where she serves as the treasurer. Massiel has been selling clothes by request for two years. Working in this manner enables her to help her partner with the household expenses.

Her goals are to be a great businesswoman in her field and to have her own vending post in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pastora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Pastora  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de sus padres 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra una vaca) que de las ferias de ganado vacuno y posteriormente lo comercializará mediante la venta de carne. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el salud y los ahorros.

Las señoras Bertha Y Teresa esconden su rostro por timidez, ya que no estan acostubradas a las fotografías.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosales” is starting its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Tejada Center.  This group consists of nine members who are led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Pastora.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various business activities in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors.  

Sra. Pastora says that this is her first loan cycle while working with Pro Mujer.  She joined the organization after being invited by her fellow group members.  At the moment, she has a business raising cattle and has been working for many years.  Pastora learned this trade from her parents.  

The loan she is requesting now will increase her capital so that she can buy a cow at the livestock fair.  She will sell it later for the meat.  Working in this manner enables to generate income to support her family as much as possible.  Pastora is married and has 10 children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pastora said that she enjoys the health services and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mampatim 02 Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Juillet 2008 le groupe Mampatim 02 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Il  est composé de 22 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Bobo debout à l’extrême droite est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans, est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle prendre en charge cinq autres proches parents.

Elle est vendeuse de patte d’arachide dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans. Son activité antérieure était la vente de légumes.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de la patte d’arachide pour la revente.

Les profits tirés de son activité l’aiderons à acheter de chèvres ou moutons en parti et d’autre part soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Created in July 2008, group Mampatim 02 has gone through more than five cycles in the “Banc Villageois” program. It is composed of 22 women who reside in the same village. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Bobo, who is standing all the way to the right, is the group’s leader. She is 54 years old, married and a mother of seven. She has five other close relatives in her care.

She retails groundnut paste at the various weekly markets of neighboring villages, and has been in this business for over five years. Her previous occupation was selling vegetables.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase groundnut paste to resell. Profit from this activity will help her to purchase goats or sheep on the one hand, and to help her husband provide for the family’s expenses on the other.

loans.use: to purchase ground nut paste for retail.

loans.name: Mampatim 01 Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Juillet 2008 le groupe Mampatim 01 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Il  est composé de 18 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kandé  debout à l’extrême droite est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  60 ans, mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a en charge aussi trois petits fils.

Elle vend de la patte des fruits et légumes dans le marché du village. Elle a plusieurs années d’expérience de ce domaine d’activité. Au para avant elle a pratiqué l’agriculture. 

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des fruits et légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des membres de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
Created in July 2008, group Mampatim 01 has gone through more than five cycles in the “Banc Villageois” program. It is composed of 18 women who reside in the same village. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Kandé, who is standing all the way to the right, is the group’s leader. She is 60 years old, married and a mother of six. She also has three grandsons in her care.

She retails fruit jellies and vegetables at the village market. She has several years of experience in this business. She previously was a farmer.

With her new loan, she is going to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

Profit from this activity will allow her to support her husband in providing for the family members’ food, healthcare and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to retail

loans.name: Herlin Santana

texts.es:
El señor Herlin, trabaja en una empresa privada como guillotinista, es padre de dos hijas, con su esposa han logrado la cosntruccion de su vivienda, a si como el apoyo mutuo para cubrir los gastos, ya que tambien trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas.
Don Herlin ha venido haciendo mejora a su casa a traves del financiamiento, lo que ha avanzado mucho, con los creditos anteriores logro terminar el muro en la parte de atrás de su casa, dando mejor seguridad a su propiedad  como  a su familia.
Lo que quiere es comenzar el porche, logrando mejor espacio para su familia. en donde comprara materiales en piedras, bloques, quintales de hierro, bolsas de cementos, perlines, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Don Herlin works for a private company as a cutting machine operator. He is the father of two daughters. Herlin and his wife have built their own home and help each other with covering the expenses. He also works as a sales manager.

Don Herlin has been able to make improvements to his home through financing. He accomplished a great deal with his previous loans, such as finishing the wall behind his house so that he can have greater security over his property and for his family.

Herlin wants to begin building a porch so that he can provide more space for his family. He plans to buy stones, blocks, iron, bags of cement, and crossbeams so that the work can begin.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a porch.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maimouna  est une femme mariée de 54 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 12 et 18 ans. Elle évolue depuis plusieurs années dans le commerce de produits alimentaires. La raison fondamentale du choix de son activité est la recherche de source de revenus. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 1999. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires (riz, mais, sucre lait et divers autres produits ).Son objectif est  d’accroitre les bénéfices générées par son activité  qui lui permettront de payer les frais de  scolarité de ses enfants et participer  a  assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: Maimouna is 54 years old and married with 3 children aged between 12 and 18. She lives in Senegal. She has been selling food for several years in order to earn a living, and has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since 1999. Maimouna is a requesting a loan of 200 000 francs in order to restock on food products (rice, corn, sugar, milk, etc.). Her goal is to increase her business profits so that she can pay for her children's education and contribute to the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es natural de la zona de Cullpa Alta, lugar donde vive actualmente. Su vida siempre ha sido el campo, pues sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en esta actividad, es así que la agrícultura y ganadería han sido parte de su vida y lo serán, más aún que gracias a éste trabajo puede sostener y educar a sus hijos. Es así que cada día se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros, pues los compra cuando están tiernos para luego encargarse de su alimentación y al cabo de un tiempo alcanzan el peso exacto para ser vendidos y a un mejor precio. Del mismo modo sucede con las vacas a diferencia que primero son fertilizadas, para obtner las crías y extraer la leche. Su deseo de Ana es isntalar una pequeña empresa de producción de leche, y para ello se esta capacitando. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, trigo, cebada y olluco, considerandolo de ser un trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Es será su crédito número 13 que esta solicitando a MFP, ya que espera comprar más animales y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ana is a native of the District of Cullpa Alta and currently resides there.  Her life has always been spent in the fields since her parents taught her everything about farming and raising livestock since this was and would always be how they earned their living.  Thanks to her work, Ana is able to support her children and provide them with an education.  Each day is spent raising cows and bulls.  She buys these animals as young calves and then feeds them until they reach the exact weight so that they can be sold for a good price.  However, the difference is that she holds on to the cows for breeding and milk production.  Ana’s wish is to start a small milk production business since she is receiving training on how to do this.  In addition to raising cattle, she grows potatoes, corn, wheat, barley, and ulluco.  She considers farming to be a job that requires much effort.  

This will be the 13th loan that she has requested from MFP.  She plans to buy more animals and sacks of compost.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sacks of compost.

loans.name: Las Prosperas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Luz es soltera tiene 40 años y no tiene hijos,pertenece alalcom "Las Prosperas de Carabayllo" su cargo es de Tesorera,tiene aproximadamente vendiendo cinco años, con esto cubre sus gastos personales y tambien apoya a su mami que es una persona anciana. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y tener su propio local en donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Luz is single.  She is 40 years old and doesn't have children.  She belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Prosperas de Carabayllo", where she is the Treasurer.

She has been selling beauty products for approximately five years, which covers her personal expenses and also supports her mom who is elderly.

Her goal is to be able to continue working and have her own premises for selling her products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Bris

texts.es: Bris tiene 25 años, vive en casa de su madre , en su tierra natal con sus padres y sus 2 hijos.
