Unurjav, 26, lives with her husband and younger brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Mongolia's Hovd Province. Her husband and brother both have their private businesses, and Unurjav started her business in 2010 by selling dairy products at the Han-Ord local market. During the summertime, she works at a construction site with her husband.

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products at wholesale prices. A hard-working and diligent woman, Unurjav says, "My life is getting better each day .... Now everyone in my family is working. In the future, I want to have a good business and good income sources."

loans.use: To purchase dairy products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 27 years old and lives with his wife and  son in a ger—a Mongolian yurt— in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife has worked as an accountant at the local eldercare house for two years. 

He started to fix cars and trucks at Khaan Auto Body Shop in 2005 and has worked there ever since. He has many years of business and practical experience and is a diligent and hard-working man. He says "I want to have my own auto body shop. Since my wife is working and my son is attending kindergarten, I am ready to start my business. I will work hard." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts and equipment for the business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Munhnaran

texts.en:
Munhnaran, 30, lives with his children, who both attend high school, and his wife, who supports the family business, in a house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a city in Mongolia.

Munhnaran, who started his business in 2009 by selling Israeli shoes at the Harhorin market, rents a commercial space at the market for 39,000 MNT per month. His daily sales income is 100,000 MNT, and his monthly profit is between 400,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT. He adds warm materials to the shoes in the winter to increase his volume of sales.

Munhnaran is requesting a 740,000 MNT loan to buy more shoes for the business. A responsible and hard-working man with many years of business and work experience, he says, "I want to obtain an apartment leasing loan in the near future."

loans.use: to buy shoes for his business.

loans.name: Gandiimaa

texts.en: Gandiimaa is 52 years old and lives with her two children and husband in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  Her two children are college students.  Her eldest son works in South Korea and pays his own college tuition fees.  Her husband is a carpenter and sells wooden furniture.  Gandiimaa started her business in 1990 by selling goods such as cigars, matches, paper towels, and other similar products at the local market.  She also sells food products that are in high demand.  Her commercial space is located in a very crowded place.  She supplies the products she sells from the province's central town.  Her sales income and profit are good enough to cover the basic running costs.  In the past, she has taken two business loans from XacBank.  She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more products.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Davaadolgor

texts.en: Davaadolgor is 52 years old and lives with her children, grandchildren, and husband in a ger (a portable dwelling) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Two of her daughters have jobs in the town.  One of her daughters is a college student.  Her two granddaughters are high school students.  Davaadolgor started her business in 1996 by opening a shoe repair service.  Her husband also has the same business and profession.  Additionally, they make traditional Mongolian shoes.   She has many years of work and business experience.  Previously, she provided the services from one location with her husband.  Now, they are running their businesses separately.  She is well known in the town because of her work and quality of service.  She took five loans from XacBank beforehand and expanded her business successfully.  Although she lives with many people, her family income and situation are getting better each day.  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials and to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make and repair shoes.

loans.name: Bergenbek

texts.en: Bergenbek is 34 years old and lives with his wife, brother, and father in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia.  His wife is currently unemployed.  His brother is working at a local company.  His father is in pension but used to work in local transportation.  Since his father's retirement in 2005, Bergenbek started to drive a transportation truck.  Now he transports coals from the Hongor mine.  He has many years of work and business experience.  He is a diligent and hard-working man who says, "I want to change my current truck for a bigger one so that I can increase my income and build a good life."  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase coal, store petrol, and to fix his truck.  He mentions that the demand of coal is increasing due to the approaching winter season.

loans.use: to purchase coal, store petrol, and to fix his truck.

loans.name: Batsanaa

texts.en: Batsanaa is 22 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  His wife works at the Snow White ice-cream factory and his daughter stays at home.  Batsanaa started to drive a taxi in 2009 which belonged to his father.  In 2010 he married and bought a new car for his taxi service.  He has developed a good business and good work experience.  He is a diligent and open-minded man who says, "I want to have a good car so that I can make more money and develop my life."  He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi service.

loans.name: Aruinaa

texts.en: Aruinaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  Her husband is disabled and stays at home.  Aruinaa started her business in 2005 by making felt arts and coral souvenirs.  Now she sells the products and souvenirs at Ulaanbaatar City.  She has many years of experience and has a regular client base.  In the future, she plans to export the products and souvenirs to the neighboring cities of China.  She is also a member of the Mongolian Hand-Craft Association.  She is a diligent and hard-working woman who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and other supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and other supplies for her hand craft business.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Sergelen is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger—a Mongolian yurt—in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a security guard of the vegetable garden. His monthly income is 130,000 MNT. 

Sergelen started her business in 2005 by making and fixing traditional Mongolian costumes from her home. Since a young age, she has made clothes and costumes, learning from her mother. 

She is planning to expand her business. She is a hard-working and diligent woman who says, "I want to open my fashion and tailor shop at the local market in the future." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase sewing materials and cloth for her business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials and cloth for her business.

loans.name: Handaa

texts.en: Handaa is 48 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (traditional nomadic tent-like dwelling) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her eldest daughter is a college student and the others are in high school. She started her business in 2004 by selling foods and other things on a mobile cart in her hometown. Now, she has her own commercial space where she sells her products. She has many years of business and work experience. She is a diligent woman who says, "I want to expand my business and then buy a container so that I can sell my goods and products easily." She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to buy products in bulk at the wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy products at the wholesale price

loans.name: Lhamhuu

texts.en: Lhamhuu is 48 years old and lives with her children and husband in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a pastor at the local Christian church. Her eldest daughter is a college student and the others are in high school. She started her business in 2009 by selling second-hand clothes. She used to rent a small commercial space at the local market but now she has extended the commercial space. She plans to continue her business in the future. She is a diligent woman who says, "Having a bigger commercial space really helps your business and increases your profits." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Jamyansuren

texts.en: Jamyansuren is 36 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (traditional nomadic tent-like dwelling) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps him manage the family business. His two children are high school students. He started his business in 2003 selling meat and livestock. He purchases livestocks and his wife sells the meat at the local market. In some cases, he buys livestock in herds and sells them in town. He has been in this business for many years. Thus, he is experienced in meat retail trading. He is a diligent and open-minded person who says, "The demand for meat is increasing so fast because of the winter season." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.use: To purchase meat and livestock

loans.name: Jeksanbai

texts.en: Jeksanbai is 42 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed. Two of his children are college students and the other four are in high school. He started his business in 2000 by transporting goods with his truck. He runs this business alone and his business income is the sole financial resource for the family. Most of the time, he transports goods per orders from companies and individuals but he also purchases flour and rice and sells them in his hometown. During the winter months, he sells coal. He goes on transportation trips from one to two times a month. During the summer season, he transports between the Bayan-Olgii province and the Hovd province. He is a diligent and hard working man who says "This year, the road to the city of Ulaanbaatar is very good. I want to buy some goods from the city and sell them here." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to fix his truck, store some gasoline, and use for the trade.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Herlentsetseg

texts.en: Herlentsetseg is 53 years old and lives in a house in the Hentii province of Mongolia.  Her children are living seperately.  She started her business in 1991 by sewing clothes and costumes from her home.  Now she rents a building to run her business and this is her fifth year renting the same building.  Mostly she makes Mongolian traditional costumes and uniforms.  She has many years of business and work experience.  Her traditional costumes are well recognized in the town.  She is a hard-working, diligent woman who says, "I have been making clothes for all my life.  This is the only thing I can do.  Also my business brings sufficient income for me.  In the future, I plan to make European clothes."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cloth and materials to make uniforms.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and materials to make uniforms.

loans.name: Badam

texts.en: Badam is 60 years old and lives alone in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province.  Although she is over 60, her health is in good condition. She used to live with her disabled son who is now living with his brothers in Ulaanbaatar City.  She started her business in 2006 by selling flour and dried yogurt in Han-ord local market.  She was selling them from a mobile cart.  Now she rents a commercial space at the Ih Buyan market.  Her business income is enough to cover all costs.  She plans to keep running this business.  She is a hard working woman who says, "The increasing price of gasoline is bringing up the prices of other goods.  But, I will continue to do my business."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more flour and other product for her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour and other products for her business.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es: El Señor Víctor es casado y tiene 02 hijos que están en etapa escolar, él señor se dedica al servicio de transporte (TAXI) desde hace 02 años, comenzó alquilando el carro a su hermano y con el tiempo se compró su auto propio que tiene en la actualidad, el crédito solicitado es para comprar algunos accesorios a su auto (4 llantas), arreglar su motor y hacer una reparación general para que esté en perfectas condiciones para su labor diaria y así poder brindar un buen servicio. El Sueño del Señor Víctor y de su familia es el tener la casa propia, y además el tener una empresa de servicio de transporte (TAXI) para así poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida. El Señor Víctor está muy agradecido por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor is married and has two children who are of school age. He has been providing taxi services for two years. Victor started out by renting a car from his brother and over time was able to buy his own vehicle which he now uses. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a few accessories for his taxi (four tires). He will also pay to have the motor fixed as well as for general repairs so that his vehicle will be in perfect condition for his daily work. This will enable him to provide good service.

Sr. Victor dreams of owning a house with his family. In addition, he wants to start a taxi company so that he can generate more income and have a better quality of life. Sr. Victor is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase four tires and pay for repairs to keep his taxi in good condition.

loans.name: Rosa Milagros

texts.es: La Señora Rosa de 29 años es Soltera y con un hijo de 12 años, la señora tiene su negocio que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche, pollo, aceite, verduras), además de golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros,  la idea de poner esta negocio es porque no existía una tienda en el lugar donde vive y vio la necesidad que tienen los clientes al requerir estos productos de primera necesidad, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de una congeladora con la finalidad de conservar mejor sus productos (pollo, verduras, gaseosas), además de incrementar su tienda con la compra de más productos. Su gran sueño de la señora Rosa es tener su casa propia, la señora está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en: Rosa is 29 years old, single, and has a 12-year-old son.  She has a business selling groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, chicken, oil, and vegetables), in addition to sweets, soft drinks, and other things.  She had the idea to start this business because there was no store in the area where she lives, and she recognized her customers’ need for basic foodstuffs.  The loan she requests is to invest in buying a freezer in order to better conserve her products (chicken, vegetables, soft drinks), and increase her store by buying more products.  Rosa’s big dream is to have her own home and she is very appreciative of the opportunity being given to her.

loans.use: buy a freezer and products (groceries, sweets, soft drinks, and others) to better stock her store.

loans.name: Martin Eudocio

texts.es: El Señor Martin es soltero con 02 hijos de 25 y 30 años de edad, tiene su negocio hace 02 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (pollo, azúcar, leche, arroz, verduras),  productos de limpiezas (lejia, jabón, shampoo), entre otros  el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de más mercaderia para abastecer así mejor su negocio y así sus clientes tenga mejores opciones a la hora de comprar. Su gran desafío del Señor Martin es un dolor a los huesos que lo viene llevando hace varios años. Su gran sueño del señor es incrementar mejor su tienda para así poder tener mejores ingresos, además de terminar de construir su vivienda para poder tener una mejor comodidad tanto él y sus nietos, a la vez está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin is single and has two children, ages 25 and 30. For the past two years, he has managed a business selling groceries (chicken, sugar, milk, rice, vegetables) and cleaning products (bleach, soap, shampoo). The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise so that he can better stock his business. This will provide his customers better options when they purchase.

His greatest challenge is the pain in his bones that he has been experiencing for many years. On the other hand, his greatest wish is to expand his store so that she can generate more revenue. In addition, he wants to finish the construction of his house so that he and his grandchildren will be more comfortable. Martin is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Dimar

texts.es: El Sr. Dimar, nacido en Chuquisaca no es casado pero convive con la Sra. María, tienen dos hijos. Ella es ama de casa, y él se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace más de 10 años, ellos viven en el Porvenir  en la provincia cordillera. Distante a 40 km. De Limoncito Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que han solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra y también siembran maíz, sorgo, y poroto. Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo al consumidor en el mercado de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Dimar was born in Chuquisaca. He is not married, but he lives with Sra. María and they have two children. She is a homemaker while Dimar engages in farming and raising livestock. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. Dimar and his family live in El Porvenir in a mountain province that is 40 km from Limoncito Torno.

He has a parcel of land where he grows watermelon, corn, citrus fruits, and cassava. Dimar is requesting a loan for growing watermelon and covering the expenses related to preparing his land. He also wants to plant corn, sorghum, and beans. Everything he produces is sold directly to the consumer at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing watermelon and to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco  hace 21 años que vive en una comunidad lejana del torno; en villa San Carlos a 28 km. De limoncito. Tiene su parcela, donde vive y trabaja agricultura. El es casado con la Sra. Isabel su esposa quien es  ama de casa. Con 8 hijos todos trabajan con su padre en agricultura, donde siembran: maíz, sandia, maní, yuca y también se dedican  a la ganadería todo lo que ellos ayudan a sembrar a su papa y todo lo que siembran lo sacan a vender al mercado el torno, el Sr. Francisco que trabajan con emprender porque es  la única institución que les ha brindado su ayuda,  el crédito que ha solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y maíz y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra,  son una familia muy unida y trabajadora y se sienten agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Francisco has lived in a community far from El Torno for 21 years.  He lives in San Carlos, a small town that is 28 kilometers from Limoncito.  He owns a parcel of land where he lives and does agricultural work.

He is married to Isable, a housewife.  They have eight children, and they all work with their father doing the farm work.  He grows corn, watermelon, peanuts, and yucca.  He also devotes himself to livestock.  They all help their father plant, and everything they grow they take to sell at the El Torno market.

Francisco works with Emprender because it is the only institution that has offered him help.  The loan that he has requested is to plant watermelon and corn and for the expenses that are involved in preparing the land.  

They are a very close and hard-working family.  They are grateful for the support that the institution has provided.

loans.use: to plant watermelon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baking ingredients and other groceries for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ladies and men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 62 years old and married. He is the old father of eight lovely children. Four of his children are married and live independently, and his other four children are all single. Presently, Kong generates business as a rice farmer located in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. From this business he can earn $1.50 USD each day. To assist his income, two of his children are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh where they can earn a fixed salary each month. 

Due to the rainy season, Kong would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials but he lacks money so he wishes to request funds through Kiva's partner, HKL. Kong hopes that this loan will allow him to produce more output than in other years, and he hopes to one day build a bigger house. Kong is very grateful to all lenders that provide these funds to his family. This is his first loan from Kiva and HKL.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 56 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children.

Leonida has been a tailor since 1975.  Aside from tailoring, she has also been engaged in a hog raising business for three years.  She make and repairs men's, women's and kid's clothing.  From the business she manages, she is able to earn about P6,000 a month.  According to Leonida, she uses her income to buy feed, pay for school tuition, to pay electric bills, and for the maintenance of their corn farming.  She would like her child to finish the college level.  For this reason she is doing her best by maintaining and improving the quality of clothing she sews. 

Leonida decided to apply for a loan amounting to P15,000 in order to buy garments and accessories of dress for her tailoring business, and three piglets for her hog raising business.  She is aiming to gain more profits in order to sustain the financial needs and daily needs in their life.

loans.use: to buy garments and accessories of dress for her tailoring business and three piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som, 49, is a nice resident in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. Together with her husband, who is a rice farmer, she has raised two children. One of her children has already married and lives in a separate house, and the other is single. To assist the family’s income, her son generates business as a tailor in a market far away from the house. Seeing the high expenses for a motor taxi, Som and her family have decided to purchase their own motorbike. To fund the purchase, she would like to apply for a loan through Kiva's partner, HKL. Som and her family hope that this loan will allow them to gain more profits and save. She is very thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 23 years old, married, and has two infant children. To generate income and support the family, Jennifer has been managing her hog raising business for almost three years. Since Jennifer's parents struggled financially, she wasn't able to finish her college education and seek good employment. She also married early. Jennifer doesn't want her children to experience the same hardship as she has. She is determined to send them both to school. Profits earned form the business are being saved in preparation for her children's education. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the pigs. With good nutrition, she will be able to sell the hogs at a higher price when they are ready for sale.

In the future, Jennifer wants to achieve financial stability. She also wants to see both of her children get a degree and good employment some day.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the pigs

loans.name: Chhieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhieng, 39, is a kind resident in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. Together with her husband, who is a rice farmer, she has raised four children, none of whom are married yet. To help the family’s income, her daughter is employed as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh where she can earn $70 per month, and the other three kids are attending school. 

To improve their living standards, Chhieng and her family would like to purchase a motorbike. To fund this purchase, she has decided to borrow from Kiva's partner, HKL. She hopes that this loan will give her family happiness and prosperity. She is very grateful to all kind lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family

loans.name: La Arnie Lee

texts.en:
La Arnie is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She has been selling motorcycle parts and other similar products for four years. Her business is located in a shop near her home. According to her, she has regular customers and she is glad because her husband is her helper in their business. She would like to buy a stock of spare parts so that she could minimize her expenses in going to and from the place where she buys her products.

La Arnie is requesting a loan in the amount of P35,000 in order to buy a large quantity of spare parts such as tires, oils, motorcycle accessories, mufflers, fenders, chains, and sprockets for her spare parts shop so that she can continue to sell. According to her, the money she earns will be used to repay the loan, improve her family’s standard of living, and save some funds for the preparation of schooling of her daughter. She works hard because she would like to attain success in business and in her life. She hopes that through her business she would be able to fulfill her goal which is to become a successful business woman and model mother to her daughter and friends.

loans.use: to buy tires, oils, motorcycle accessories, mufflers, fenders, chains, and sprockets for her spare parts shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Bernita

texts.en:
Bernita is 58 years old and widowed. She is currently living with her nieces because she doesn't have children.

Bernita has been operating a tailoring business for almost 21 years in their village. According to her, she is getting older and yet she would like to improve her business by putting up a dress shop and store in front of her house so that she could encourage more customers. Due to her determination in life, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy materials needed to put up her dress shop and garments for her tailoring business.
 
She hopes that she can obtain her loan request so that she can establish her dress shop and store. She believes that through her business, she could sustain her daily needs and save for her security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy materials to open a dress shop and to buy garments for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 52 years old and married to a tricycle driver. Together they raise two children. She has managed her sari-sari store (variety) for almost 30 years. With the minimal profits she earned from the business, she was able to support the daily allowances of her children. As of now, her two children have their own employment and somehow help her in times of need. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy instant noodles, canned goods, eggs and breads to sell in her store. She wants to increase her earnings to achieve financial stability and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, canned goods, eggs and breads to sell in her store.

loans.name: 3.9.83 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thơm operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Thơm is 26 years old and she is married with no children.
Thơm is the group leader of the 3.9.83 Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Thơm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thơm has been involved in this business for two years.
The main hardship that Thơm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thơm hopes to buy land of her own. She hopes that her business will do well and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en: Kenanga Indah group continues with their third loan from Muk. They are requesting a total loan of Rp 24,000,000 and a loan per member of Rp 1,500,000. Ni Komang will use the loan in this period to buy two pigs that will be prepared to be sows. She has a plan to sell the piglets. Currently, the price of piglets is between Rp 400,000 - Rp 450,000. Ni Komang will also improve the cage so that when the sows have children, the cage will be ready to contain it. From this effort, Ni Komang hopes to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy two pigs

loans.name: Amerta Kencana Group

texts.en: The Amerta Kencana group is a group consisting of 10 members who live in one village and have the same type of business. They raise pigs. This is their second loan.  Ni Putu, the head of the group, is taking a loan of Rp 1,500,000 to buy four local species piglets. Right now, she is just keeping piglets, but Ni Putu has plans to buy sows and become a piglet seller. To raise capital, she will save from the sale of her pigs during this period. Currently, the piglets are very expensive (Rp  400,000) because it is difficult to find them. That's because people rarely maintain piglets. It was seen as a good attempt by Ni Putu. She hopes the plan and her efforts will be successful with financial support and guidance from MUK.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a thirty-three-year old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family is vested in him and his dream is to educate his children. He has been farming for twenty years and the proceeds have facilitated him in providing the basics for his family. His hardship is unpredictable seasons resulting in low output. His desire is to venture into mechanised agriculture. David needs the loan to plough his garden and buy farm inputs.

loans.use: To plough his garden and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif is 41 years old and married with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children and set up sustainable income-generating activities to support them through school. He has been in the retail shop business for five years and he got the initial capital from selling coffee. His hardship is bad debtors and his vision is a wholesale business. Sharif needs the money to buy mattresses, blankets and saucepans to sell.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, blankets and saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a hardworking individual who desires to uplift her lifestyle and provide the needs of her family. According to her, being a single parent is quite hard because she has to do all the responsibilities of being a parent to her four children. All of them go to school. That's why Madelyn doubled her hard work to provide all their needs. 

Madelyn operates a restaurant located in the public market. She has had this business for one year and she's glad because some of her friends help her in running it to grow. With her determination in life, she works hard to send all her children to a higher level of education, she is asking for financial support from the lenders. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy raw meat, vegetables, soft drinks, ingredients and rice needed for her restaurant. She will be glad if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, vegetables, soft drinks, ingredients and rice needed for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 47 years old and married to Ruben. The couple was blessed with five children. Two of her children are married, two of them still study and the youngest is still an infant. Her husband is a government employee under the Department of Agriculture.

Flordeliza is engaged in a retail shop business where she sells a variety of groceries. She has had this business for three years and according to her, she is able to earn about PHP 2,000 a month doing this kind of business. With the number of family members and the high cost of basic commodities, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to be used to buy groceries such as assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients, shampoo, junk foods and soft drinks for her store. She is hoping that through her small business, she can support her children in their studies. Flordeliza would be grateful if her request loan is granted because she could increase the profit she generate from her general store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients, shampoo, junk foods and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replace the taxi motor and purchase home appliances

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 40-year-old single mother of three children living in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been the sole breadwinner of the family and her family goal is to build a family house. She has a salon business and has been operating it for 12 years. She hopes to expand it to a big one, despite the challenge of limited funds. Christine needs the loan to buy cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Seleverio

texts.en: Seleverio is a 36-year-old married man with four children and he lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to have as many income-generating businesses as possible. For five years, he has been selling animals and this has enabled him to provide basics for his family. His challenge is the ever-increasing animal prices and his desire is to diversify into the transport sector and buy a motorcycle. Seleverio needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old with one child who is in school. She is married to a soldier. She has a business selling clothes in the Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her child to go to school and to build a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: St Thereza Women Group

texts.en: Alex is a thirty-one-year old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. His greatest desire is to educate his children to university level. He has been repairing electronics for ten years and, with the profits, he has been able to build his own house. His hardship is lack of enough capital to buy the necessary machines. His vision is to have an electronic shop. Alex needs the loan to buy a machine for electronic repairs.

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Abduvakos

texts.ru: Абдувакос проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он у себя дома занимается торговлей. В основном продает сухофрукты. В этой области он уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов сухофруктов.
texts.en: Abduvakos lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 45 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. He works from home in trade. He sells dried fruit. He has been doing this for fifteen years. He is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of dried fruit.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of dried fruit.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 39 years old. She sells wall decorations to locals in the village where she lives with her family and four children. She usually earns P500 for each item sold. She had to generate income to provide sustenance for her family. Her eldest child had to stop going to college due to insufficient funds. She had to work and help assist her parents to provide income for the family. Instead of sending them all to school, one of them had to make a sacrifice. Lolita felt guilty about their situation. 

She is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to have additional capital to buy wall decorations and paintings to sell in the village to make extra profits.

In the future, Lolita would like to strengthen her decoration sales to help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy wall decorations and paintings to sell in the village

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 35 years old and is married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with one child. Merlinda has a retail store based in a school. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to invest in stock such as biscuits, soft drinks, school supplies, banana cue, "pancit" (noodles) and macaroni soup to sell. She has been running her business for five years and she is thankful because her income has been increasing.

Her family is her motivation for improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by bringing in additional income and supporting her children in their studies. She hopes that she can get the amount she has requested.

loans.use: to invest in stock such as biscuits, soft drinks, school supplies, banana cue, "pancit" and macaroni soup

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
Federica is 48 years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through vegetable production and sales. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and to save for the future of her children.

Now she wants to plant more vegetables to increase her production but, due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of P15, 000 (Philippine pesos) to buy seeds and fertilizers. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yields. She is hoping that she is going to harvest a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Sophin (in the photo), 42, lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with two sons and one daughter. Two assist their mother in the business and the other one is still young. 

Sophin is a banana and flower farmer. Her two children sell the flowers and bananas in Phnom Penh market.  

Sophin is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to carry bananas and flowers to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to transport flowers and bananas to market.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 38 years old, married and has five children. They live in San Luis, Cauayan City. She sells fish and vegetables while her husband manages their rice fields. He also helps her sell fish in their village. Elvira uses her income to pay her children's tuition fees, to pay the electricity bill and for her family's daily needs. 

Visitacion is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase vegetable seeds and different kinds of fish to sell. Elvira hopes to increase her profits so that she can meet the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that, through her patience in managing her business, she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds such as eggplant, okra, string beans and to acquire different fish such as tilapia and milk fish to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Burgos Cabarroguis is near the market but there is a part of this village wherein the houses are in a mountainous place. Yolanda and her family live happily and peacefully in the mountainous part where there is no electric power. Her family only uses a generator as their source of light in the evening. The couple have been blessed with eight children but currently only live with their three single children.

Yolanda has been buying and selling bananas for 10 years. She is thankful because, even though their house is in the mountainous part, she still works hard to sustain their needs. She would like to buy additional bananas so that her profit will increase. So she is asking for a loan of P7,000. This amount would really help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for her fruit selling business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 65 years old, married and has eight children with whom he lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major dream is to become a role model as a farmer as well as completing his family house. John is a commercial tea farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for the past twenty years. His major challenge is hailstorms which destroy his tea. His dream is to own at least 100 acres of tea as he currently has only 20 acres. John needs the loan to pay workers who are ploughing his garden.

loans.use: To pay workers who are ploughing his garden.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a married woman with two children. She is 35 years old and she has a business selling frozen foods and different kinds of vegetables such as string beans, squash and eggplants. She has been running her business for almost 1 year. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds to plant and vegetables such as string beans, squash and eggplants to sell. Her husband is a worker, and adds to their daily income. Each month, Emely earns PHP 6,000 net income. This helps her support their daily needs, especially her children's education. 

She dreams that her business will become more productive so she can continue to send her children to school and to give her family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant and vegetables such as string beans, squash and eggplants to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 46 years old with one child who is not schooling. She is married to a man who is working in the Ministry of Forestry. She has a business of selling food products like beans, groundnuts and flour in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business and she says that she will use the profit from this loan for building a department store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and flour to sell

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 38 years of age, married, and had been blessed with three children. She has been running her hog raising business for over 21 years. She also sells different kinds of vegetables such as eggplants, string beans, and squash within their village. The daily net profit of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) is just enough to cover the cost of daily meals and allowances for her children. 

Siony is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP to purchase feed and medicine for the pigs vaccination, and also to acquire different kinds of vegetables to sell. She hopes to grow her hog raising business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for the pigs vaccination, and to acquire different kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Song Eng

texts.en:
Song eng (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver, and lives across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1995 and has one son who is in school.

Song eng hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession business. That’s why she is asking for another loan of $200 USD to by silk materials.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Phos

texts.en:
Phos (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver. She lives with her brother and sisters in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phos is asking for a loan of $1,200 to continue her silk weaving business by buying silk materials.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Фотима имеет высшее образование. Она по профессии товаровед. В этой области она проработала 25 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время Фотима занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей и цветных ниток.
texts.en: Fotima lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is in Russia. Fotima has a higher education.She is a merchandiser by profession. She has worked in her profession for 25 years.  Additionally, in her free time she sews traditional dresses. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric and different-colored thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Komsuor

texts.en:
Komsuor (in the photo) is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives in a village near the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Komsuor sells silk and cotton fabric and scarves. She buys them from the weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other places away from her house such as Kampong Speu, Kampong Cham, Kampong Chhnang, etc. 

Komsuor hopes to expand her business by buying additional silk and cotton fabric and scarves to sell, so she is asking for a loan to provide her capital.

loans.use: To purchase additional silk and cotton fabric and scarves to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sophea, 37, and her husband Sokha, 32, have been married since 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. They live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheap is a garment worker, while her husband drives a motor remoque (a motorbike with a trailer attached at the back) taxi. She is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has operated her sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house for almost 20 years. A widow, she works hard to sustain her family and is especially mindful of the education of her four children, two of whom are enrolled in a college/university. Wilma wants them to obtain a degree and achieve gainful employment someday that surpasses her own meager achievements.

Requesting a loan of P19,000 to help buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, coffee, bread and eggs, these additional items, to be sold in the store, wil help her earn more profits.

In the future, Wilma would like to diversify her business and establish a more convenient store to stock her items properly in order to attract more customers. She also hopes to achieve a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, coffee, bread and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help her brother to buy motorbike and trailer to carry wood for sale.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 37 years old and lives in the village of Coluban Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child to care for.  

Marisa has engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. Her husband drives the motorcycle. She has been doing this for over two years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle accessories for a better service quality. 

Marisa joined GDMPC in 2010 and this will be her third loan. She was able to repay previous loans in full. 

In the future, Marisa hopes to sustain the daily needs of the family. She plans to further improve the service, appearance and quality of her business to attract more passengers and start saving for her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories for a better quality of service.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is 43 years old and lives in Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two school-age children. 

Felma runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. It is a habal-habal, as folks call it, that carries two to six passengers and normally is seen in rural areas, especially mountainous places. She has had this business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 from GDMPC to repair her motorcycle for better service.  

Felma has been a GDMPC member since 2010. This current loan is her fifth. All previous loans were repaid in full. 

In the future, Felma hopes to expand and improve service and seating capacity to have more income and sustain the everyday needs of the family. She plans to repair her house, too.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle for better service.

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en:
Gisma is 27 years old with three children, two of whom are in school. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Gisma requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase designer dresses to sell. She says that she will use the extra income to build a very big shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oen

texts.en:
Oen sells bananas and mangos. She buys them under contract from fellow villagers and transports them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a wooden-house builder. They have been married since 2004 and have no children yet. They are living in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City 

Oen is requesting a loan of 700 USD to buy a cow to raise. She will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers babies.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 41 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Marlon owns and operates a motorcycle to earn a living. It is called habal-habal, a single motorcycle capable of carrying two to six passengers and commonly seen in remote or rural areas. He has been doing this for over six years already. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 2,000. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to repair the motorcycle and provide better service to passengers.  

Marlon joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2010. This is his second loan cycle from the cooperative. 

In the future, Marlon hopes to pursue business operations sooner and improve service offerings. He also plans to lay aside a portion of his earnings for the education of his growing children.

loans.use: To repair the motorcycle.

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar, 32, lives with his two daughters and wife in the house of his relative. 

He is a lawyer and new in this field. Zorigtbaatar started his career just last year and currently he is working as a lawyer in a non-government organization that runs a legal consulting service.
 
In winter time, his family lives in a winter house that is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  But the house is becoming old and it has been losing heat lately. 

He decided to make a renovation and insulate the walls of the house because Mongolian winter is freezing cold and unhealthy to live in. Also there will be no heat loss after the making insulation, so it will be beneficial for the spending of fuel or firewood.  
 
Therefore he is requesting a loan to purchase some building materials to renovate and insulate his house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to renovate and insulate his house.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Hog raising is Rodel's primary source of income. By raising hogs, he usually gains a profit of PHP 2,000 for each hog disposed. Income generated from the business goes for daily meals and allowances for his children. Other parts of the income are used as revolving capital to keep maintaining the business. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy medicines and vitamins for his hogs. With the help of the vitamins and medicines, he can ensure that they will acquire proper growth and good nutrition. 

In the future, he would like to strengthen his hog raising business for the education of his children. He also would like to establish a larger pig pen for his hogs.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Sochea, is a motortaxi driver. They have four children and live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Srey is asking for a loan of $100 to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность всем социальным инвесторам Кива, которые поддержали первый кредит Рахат, использованный по назначению и погашенный без просрочек. 
Рахат начала свой бизнес в перепродаже галантерейных изделий в  2004 году, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме всего лишь 1,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Рахат имеет в наличии товарооборот на сумму 30,000 (KGS) сом и наличные средства в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) для закупа товара.   Для дальнейшего увеличения своего товарооборота, Рахат повторно обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на оплату обучения сына, а в дальнейшем – на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Company "Bai-Tushum and Partners" expresses a sincere appreciation to all social investors from Kiva, who supported Rahat's first loan, which she used as directed and repaid without delays.  Rahat started her business of with resale of haberdashery goods in 2004, using a starting capital of only 1,000 som (KGS).  Today, Rahat has a good turnover of 30,000 (KGS) som and cash resources of 15,000 som (KGS) to buy merchandise.  To further increase her goods turnover, Rahat requested a second loan in the sum of 45,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to use the income from the loan to pay for her son's education and to further expand her business.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Savan, stays at home and does house work. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Two are married, two are construction workers and the other two are garment workers. The family is living along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Phal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to rebuild his kitchen because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To rebuild his kitchen.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 55 years old and her husband, Loek, is 57 years old. They have been married since 1981 and have one daughter who is a tailor and runs a grocery store at home. The family lives about nine kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ra and her husband are rice farmers. 

She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She will also use a part of the loan to help expand her daughter’s grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.  

In the photo, Ra is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and to help expand her daughter’s grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has four children.

Fares has been an owner of a shop since 1998, where he repairs electric mixers and household appliances. He has more than 15 years experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $600 to rebuild and fix his shop’s ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to expand his work and to hire some workers so that he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To rebuild and fix his shop’s ceiling.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 31 years old with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a divorced from her husband who is a soldier. She has a business selling tea in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She earns some additional income from selling beans and sugar at home.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a kettle and glasses for tea

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn (pictured with her loom) is a widow with four children- two sons and two daughters. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lorn is a weaver and a farmer. In addition, she supplements a new pig-farming business. She wants to expand her pig-farming business by buying one more female pig, so she decided to ask for a loan for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy one more female pig to raise

loans.name: Muoki

texts.en:
Muoki has been practicing farming and selling his farm produce in Kilala, Maukueni town. He is 38 years old and married to Esther. They have four children.

Muoki was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. He paid the other loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

In the future, Muoki hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Sony

texts.en: Sony (pictured here), 23, is single. She lives with her brother and sister and parents in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sony is a cleaner for a company in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married and has five children.

Maytham has been an owner of a food market since 2003, selling sweets, soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has more than eight years experience in this field, He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan to make an outdoor ceiling and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for himself and for his wife.

loans.use: To make an outdoor ceiling and to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a  28 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 4 years, he has been operating a boutique to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy trousers and jackets. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he can access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy trousers and jackets

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is from the village Akhalterjola. She is 59 years old. Suliko is married and lives with her husband, Giorgi.  Suliko and Giorgi are retired. 

They have a family agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 cows and Suliko produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Also, they have a 0.75 hectare of land where maize is grown. Part of the maize is used in the dairy farm for feeding the cows and the remaining 200 kg of maize is sold locally.  The family also owns a vineyard with 600 vines. They sell grapes in season. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris, including their pensions. 

Suliko requested credit for renovation of the house. Their house was renovated a long time ago and is now in bad condition. After renovation, Suliko and Giorgi will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn (in the photo) is 44 years old and his wife, Kong, is 33 years old.  They have been married since 1993 and have six children.  One is married and lives in separately, one is a garment worker, three are in school, and another one is still young. They live in a village along National Road Number four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroeurn is a construction contractor and his wife is a garment worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,200 in order to buy construction materials for his construction business.  

He wants to operate a business renting out a space in his house.   He will use a part of the loan to build rooms to rent.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his construction business and to build rooms to rent.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a happy person.  Though she encounters daily problems on how to budget her income from the business, she is still optimistic that someday she will gain enough profits and will not have to live scarcely anymore.

She is 50 years old and has five children.  Two of them are enrolled in a university while the rest are in their elementary education.  Her daily minimum profit of P200 goes to their expenses such as meals and necessities for the children.  She needs to obtain more profits and that is why she is asking for an additional capital of P9,000 to buy eggs, coffee, milk, and sugar to sell in her store.

In the future, Leonida would like to keep increasing sales so that she can have good financial management to lift her family out of poverty. 
She also would like to continuously educate her children so they can pursue their own career someday.

loans.use: to buy eggs, coffee, milk, and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a hardworking business man aged 32.  He is married and blessed with one child.  For the last six years, he has been managing a pharmacy to make a living.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy medicine.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business with his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 54 yeas old and her husband To is 56 years old.  They have been married since 1980 and have five children, two sons and three daughters.  Three are married and live in separate homes, one is a teacher and the others are in school.  They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers away.
Sarom stays at home and does housework.  The main source of income is from her husband who is a motor taxi driver.  She is asking for her first loan of $300 to concrete the foundation of her house.

loans.use: to concrete the foundation of her house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old with three children. All of the children are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling food products like maize and millet in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Lucia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. Three of the children work.

Ali has been an owner of a blacksmith and painting workshop since 1990. He repairs and paints old and new cars body. He has more than 20 years experience in this field. He has a good reputation, a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to purchase a balancing machine for cars. He is trying to develop his work by adding modern machinery to his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a balancing machine for cars.

loans.name: Eun

texts.en:
Eun is 51 years old and has been running a grocery store at home for ten years.  Her husband Nhak who is 54, is a farmer.  They have seven children, five sons and two daughters.  One is married and lives outside the family home, two have full-time employment, one is learning hair dressing skills, and the others are in school.  They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Eun is requesting her first loan of $500 to expand her grocery store by buying additional grocery items.  She will also use a portion of the loan to launch a hair salon for her daughter when she finishes her training.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store by buying additional grocery items and to launch a hair salon for her daughter who is learning hair dressing skills.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking business man.  He is married and blessed with three children.  For the last five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to support his family.  He has been able to improve his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya hence raising his living standard.  In the next five years, he wants to increase the number of cows on his farm.  He is requesting for a loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a  dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a mother of two adult-aged children and is separated from her husband. She is 58 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Nelly sells several snack items in their place to earn a living. She sells sweet puto, rice cakes, doughnuts and many more. She has received recognitions from her customers for having made the food deliciously. She has had this business for five years and gets PHP 5,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional food items to sell. 

Nelly joined GDMPC earlier this year to have access to financial services. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand and improve her product offerings to elevate sales and the daily cash inflow of the household.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a hardworking businessoman age 53. She is a single mother of two. For the last eight years, she has been tailoring to earn a living. She is able to educate her children with the income she gets from her business. In the next four years, she wants to become the distributor of fabric in her region. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she is able to access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct three cottages.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 25 years old with two children. Neither of her children is in school. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling beans and soft drinks like mango juice in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 

Beatrice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and soft drink like mango juice to sell

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married, and has six children.

Fallah has been  the owner of a store since 2000, selling women's, men's, and kids' clothing, accessories and cosmetics. He has more than ten years experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of customer needs and a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his surroundings. His store is situated in a commercial area so there are a number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2800 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his store’s floor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Marivic has operated her general store for over four years. She earns about PHP 6,000 a month.

Marivic wants to expand her family business, that’s why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase additional stocks of groceries such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, school supplies, rice and feed to retail.
 
Marivic hopes to grow her general store to secure her family's future and aims to educate her child so that she will become a professional someday. Despite the hardships of life, Marivic is striving to earn and save for the familys security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, school supplies, rice and feed to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat and baking powder.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a hardworking businesswoman aged 55. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last two years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. She also earns extra income from dairy farming. In the next five years, she wants her business to become successful. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 39 years old. She lives in the village Bardubani with her son Tornike, 20 years old, and daughter Natia, 18 years old. 

Tamar is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have three milk cows. Tamar produces 60 kg of cheese per month and sells it on the local market. Also they own vineyard with 2000 grape vines and sell grapes. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Tamar requested credit to change the roof of their house. Their roof is already old and can’t keep out the rain and snow. After repairing the roof, the house will become more comfortable and the family members will have improved their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for changing the roof of their house.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Fridah is 45 years old and married. Her primary business is tailoring. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She also has a green grocery, whereby she sells assorted vegetables. Her monthly income is 20,000 KES.

This is Fridah's fifth loan with KADET and her previous loans were successfully repaid. This loan will help her buy materials, zippers, onions, tomatoes, and other vegetables. 

The anticipated profits will be used to expand her business. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy material and zippers for tailoring and onions, tomatoes, and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has two children.

Haydar has been an owner of a restaurant since 2008; he prepares such Iraqi foods as kebabs. He has fifteen years' experience in this field, and a deep understanding of local consumers and he has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area. His restaurant is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.


He is requesting a $2800 loan to renovate and fix his restaurant’s floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his restaurant’s floor.

loans.name: Myrliza

texts.en:
Myrliza mentioned that " Hardships and difficulties" are the stepping stone towards success. She is a hard-working mother who was blessed with two children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to help her husband in providing their family needs. She aims to strengthen her business to make it a viable source of income to support the education of their children and to save for their future.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, soaps, beverages, candies and toothpaste to sell in their village. She believes that her loan will help to increase her product offerings and satisfy customers needs. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues managing her business despite problems and difficulties in life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, soaps, beverages, candies and toothpaste to sell in the village.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a hardworking businessman aged 63 and he is married. For over 10 years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman aged 31. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. Over five years, she has been managing dairy farming to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to increase the number of cows. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Furkatchon

texts.ru: Фуркатчон целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Он хочет устроит своего ребенка в хорошую садик и хочет чтоб он вырос хорошим и умным. Более 4 лет Фуркатчон занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. В основном он сеет и выращивает семена лука, пшеницы и кукуруза. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота. В сегодняшний день он имеет 2 голов коров и 8 голов овца. Фуркатчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2600$ США для покупки семена и оплата за аренду земли.  Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Furkatchon is a goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  He wants to place his child into a good kindergarten and wants him to grow to be good and smart.  Furkatchon has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over four years.  He primarily sows and grows seeds of onions, wheat and corn.  Besides this, he is involved in raising livestock.  Today he has two cows and eight sheep.  Furkatchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $2600 for the purchase of seeds and payment for land lease.  He thanks everyone, who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for land lease

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hardworking businesswoman aged 31. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last four years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. Through the loans she gets from Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her business well. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last 10 years, he has been doing electronic repairs to make a living. In the next five years, he wants his business to become successful. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy phone and electronic accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy phone and electronic accessories.

loans.name: Tomato Group

texts.en:
Elina, who is in her mid-30s, is married with five children who go to school. Her husband is staying very far away from her.  She has had a vegetable business since 2009. She is also a local herbalist. She works from 8 a.m to 12 noon daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy an irrigation machine, increased the vegetable business and took care of her children. She has paid back both her prior loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the vegetable stock and to plant and sell more watermelon.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tomato" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her vegetable stock and to plant and sell more watermelon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Melody is engaged in retailing charcoal and rice in their village to generate additional income. She is a mother who has two school-aged children. She aims to sell more charcoal and rice to earn more income and support the education of their children since her husband's income is not sufficient to satisfy all their needs. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy additional stocks of charcoal and rice to sell in the village. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income. She is hoping that in the future, they will overcome poverty and uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal and rice to sell in the village.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old, married, and she and her husband have  two children. She is running a retail shop  which she has been doing  for the last eight years. 


She learned about KADET  LTD through marketing done by the KADET staff within Narok. She is a good client and this is her first loan which she is planning to use to increase her stock of goods. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business.
