Her hope and dream is to become a great businesswoman. She is an energetic woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old, married and has two children. To generate income and provide sustenance for the education of her children, Lourdes rents a stall in the public market and operates her beauty salon. Lourdes provides haircut services and she also does hair curling and coloring for all occasions such as weddings, debuts and graduations. She usually earns about P3,000 each month.

Lourdes is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy hair brushes, hair dyes, scissors and blowers to use in her beauty salon to improve the services rendered to her customers thus increase her earnings, too. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to have a good financial management in order to uplift her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair brushes, hair dyes, scissors and blowers to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rustamchon

texts.ru: Рустамчон умный, образованный и добросовестный муж. За последнее 5 лет он занимается купля продажей скота. Он покупает скот и рынка, затем откармливает их в определенный период, а когда они набирают вес, Рустамчон продает их в выгодную цену. Он хочет расширить данный бизнес и получить большую прибыль для содержания своей семьи. Он хотел бы получить кредит для покупки скота. Рустамчон заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их доброты и милосердие.
texts.en: Rustamchon is a smart, educated and conscientious husband.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for the last five years.  He buys livestock at the market, then fattens it up over a certain time period and, once it gains weight, Rustamchon sells it at a more profitable price.  He wants to expand his business and make a large profit in order to support his family.  He wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock.  Rustamchon thanks all creditors in advance for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rampei

texts.en:
Rampei, 41 years old, is married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer and especially in wheat farming  for the last ten years.


He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his first loan which he has planned to use to purchase farm inputs, i.e., fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.


His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to higher level of education. He an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more banana suckers as well as paying labour for land clearing.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 35 years old  and a married  woman. She has two children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for a period of six years.


She knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She is a nice client who is likely to repay her loan; she is applying for  her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings, fertilizer.


She hopes to expand her farming and improve the living standard of her family. Her dreams are to see her children being educated and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gillena

texts.en:
Gillena is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman with three children and  she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the tailoring business for six years and she acquired the initial funds  to start the business from farming and bought a sewing machine. Her hardships are limited capital to meet the different tastes of customers and high taxation and  and her vision is a boutique plus educating her children.

Gillena needs the loan facility to buy a designer sewing machine and clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy a designer sewing machine and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy is a 36 year old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in the business of selling palm oil for 18 years and she inherited this business from her father. She has not met any major challenges and her desire is to trade in wholesale. Eddy needs this credit to buy palm oil from Democratic Republic of Congo.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpastes, and sweets.

loans.name: Presela

texts.en:
Presela is 48 years old with six children, all of whom are educated and working now. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling sewing baskets and tablecloths in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Presela requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items for making sewing baskets for sell

loans.name: Kiken

texts.en:
Kiken is 38 years old.  He is married with four children who are attending school.  He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

He has been a good client who repaid his previous loans well without any complications.  He applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and to buy more animals. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to expand his farm.  His dreams are to prosper in farming and to be able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, plastic bowls, clothes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking businessman aged 42. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last four years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya hence becoming more financially stable. In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni is a 36-year-old married man with two children and resides in Narok, Kenya. He is a maize farmer which he has been doing for the past three years. He learned about KADET through a registered client with KADET. 



He has been a good client and this is his first loan with which he has planned to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs.


He hopes to make profit and use it to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been rearing pigs for sale for the last six years in Kiambu town. She is 38 years old and married to Martin. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase pig feed.

In future Beatrice hopes to increase the number of pigs, to cater for the high demand for pork.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 66 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

Abbass is a carpenter; he has owned a workshop since 1968. He makes all kind of furniture, such as a bedroom, dining room, and office furniture and doors. He has a long experience in this field; he has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2500 loan in order to buy an electric power generator. He is trying to develop his work by using modern machinery for his workshop.  He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for himself and for his wife.

loans.use: In order to buy an electric power generator.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a business selling soft drinks likes mango juice, lemons and spices in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. The extra income will help to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mango juice and lemons to sell

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного двухлетнего мальчишка. Он занимается купля продажей растительного масла на местном рынке. Он имеет свою торговую точку и у него много клиентов. Более 2 лет он занимается в этой сфере бизнеса и имеет хорошую деловую репутацию среди своих конкурентов.  Акмал старается привозить высококачественные продукты для своих клиентов, чтобы они были довольны. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой товарооборот, с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2750$ США. Он хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Akmal is involved in buying and selling vegetable oil at the local market.  He has his own retail outlet and has many customers.  He has been involved in vegetable oil this business for over two years and has a good professional reputation among his competitors.  Akmal tries to bring in high quality products for his customers, so that they are satisfied.  He wants to expand his business and increase his goods turnover, and is requesting a loan in the amount of $2750 for this goal.  He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking business man aged 47. He is married and blessed with four children. 

For the last 6 years, he has  been operating a transport business to earn a living. Previously, he was  practicing dairy farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to service his lorry. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and hence his living standards.

loans.use: To service his lorry

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is married with seven young children. She is 39 years old and lives in the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Riza is planting and harvesting coconut trees for sale. She has been checking and enjoying the total benefits the crops can offer for over five years. She makes money from its husks, leaves, fruits and logs, too. She is earning approximately PHP 8,000 a month including some other sources of income. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding coconut production. 

Riza is a GDMPC member who registered earlier this year. In the future, Riza hopes to expand and improve her business array to bring in good return on subsequent productions. She plans to set aside a portion of her earnings for the children's education.

loans.use: To invest in expanding coconut production.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, a 23-year-old single lady, lives in Capucao, Ozamis City, Philippines with her beloved family. Marites has been growing cassava plants and vegetables to earn a living for over 10 years, having learned about farming from her parents. With a monthly income of about PHP 7,000, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers for her crops.

Marites is a GDMPC member, having joined this year to gain access to financial services to increase her crop production. In the future, she hopes to own a house and lot for the family to live on.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 27 years old  married with three children. Two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Viola requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal to sell. She says that she will use the extra income for building a store for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 35, married, and blessed with three children. He has been operating a barbershop to earn a living. He is a focused business man, and has retained his business because of his hard work. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000  Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Naume

texts.en: Naume is a 42 year old married woman with seven children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the grocery and clothing business for eighteen years, after having acquired her initial capital by selling cooking oil and coffee. Her hardships include debtors, high transportation costs, and price fluctuations. Her vision is to run a wholesale business and have an educated family. Naume needs this loan to buy soda and mineral water to sell.

loans.use: To buy soda and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Natsagdorj, 19, is an accounting student at a university. He lives with his father, mother, sister and brother in the town of Kherlen in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. His parents are herders and his sister is not yet employed. The family needs additional income from another source to improve their living conditions. Also, Natsagdorj has been paying his own school fees and meeting his basic daily needs, but over several years his costs and fees have risen dramatically. 

These factors have led Natsagdorj to decide to start his own business selling spare auto parts. He owns a small apartment downtown and wants to pledge it against the loan, which he needs to build working capital and start planning his business.

loans.use: To build working capital and start planning his auto parts business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia lives together with her family in a peaceful village planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 44 years old and has two school-age children. She aims to improve their standard of living and to give her children a bright future. To earn additional income, she runs a dress-making business which is needed in their village. She has been in this business for almost 10 years earning a profits of P6,000 a month. 

She is trying to acquire new materials for her sewing machines but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P11,000 to buy threads, needles, and fabric for her dress-making business to produce more finished products. She believes that this loan will help her grow her business and make it viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, and fabric for dress making

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 34 year old single mother of three children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a boutique selling new clothes, and has been in this type of business for six years. Her main challenge is the irregular sales that occur during some seasons, while her dream is to own at least two boutiques. Margret needs this loan to buy blankets, trousers and shirts for resale.

loans.use: To buy more blankets, trousers and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a hardworking business man. He is 41, married, and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last 4 years, he has been practicing poultry farming and running a grocery store. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his poultry business to meet the high market demand. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fruits and vegetables. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and  vegetables

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is from the village of Kveda Simoneti in the Imereti Region. He is 34 years old, married, and lives in the village with his family: wife Nana, their 7-year-old daughter, 2-year-old son, and 76-year-old mother (retired). Gela’s daughter goes to school. 

Gela has a grocery store located near the historical museum in the village. Because of the good location, along with clients from the village population, Gela gets customers from the visitors of the museum as well. 

Gela’s wife is managing the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have 4 milk cows. She produces cheese and sells it on the Kutaisi (a nearby town) open market. She also grows greens on 0.05 hectare of land and sells them on the same market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pension of Gela’s mother. 

Gela requested credit in order to increase the stock sold in the store. He will increase the assortment of the products in the store. He expects that the amount of clients will increase starting in September, as groups of schools and high-school students from various parts of the country will be visiting the museum. Sales of the store will increase and the income of the family will grow. It will impact positively the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for the store

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a 49 year old married man.  For the past 7 years he has been working as a baker, specializing in Manakish (dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat), pizza, and Saj bread, which looks like a Mexican tortilla and is used mainly in Arabic cultures.

Alberto is well known in his region, and his customers are very happy with what he provides them. That's why he is insisting on buying a new, larger Manakish oven, to fully satisfy his customers’ needs. He is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy this oven.

Alberto works hard on improving his family's social and financial situation.  He likes his bakery a lot, and hopes to keep improving it in the future so that he can achieve more of what his customers expect.

loans.use: To buy a bigger Manakish Oven

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children.

Haydar has owned a blacksmith workshop since 1990; he makes windows, doors, and covers for air conditioners. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a portable electric power generator. He is trying to develop his work by adding modern machinery to his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer himself the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a portable electric power generator.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargal, 57 is a widow and a senior builder of military construction. She lives with her 3 sons in her own apartment which is provided by her work. 
For 13 years, she has been working as a builder and was promoted by government decision a number of times. She is retiring this year and wants to have comfortable and carefree living conditions. However, her apartment has become uncomfortable to live in since it is old and cold. 
She decided to make a complete renovation of her home with her sons. She especially needs to change the windows with new ones and install a furnace for heating. Therefore, she is taking a loan to purchase some building materials and a new furnace to make renovations in her home.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials and a new furnace to make renovations in her home.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with five family members, two of whom work.

H. has been an owner of a men’s clothing shop since 2006. He has good experience and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and his shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $1000 to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can add more inventories, which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtur, 42, is a business man who runs two businesses. He lives with his wife and four children in a house owned by one of his relatives. He is primarily a meat seller at a local bazaar and also works as a transportation driver using his minivan to supplement the family income. 

For many years, he has been saving money from his businesses in order to purchase his own piece of land. But he is falling short of little money to cover the land payment. Buying this land is very important for his family. Therefore he is taking a loan as additional funding to purchase the land. He has taken loans twice earlier and has repaid successfully on time.

loans.use: as additional funding to purchase his own piece of land for his family

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Fallah is 57 years old and married with four children in Iraq. He has owned an electrical supplies store since 2009. He has good experience from his previous work in the electricity department of a larger company. Fallah also has a good reputation and is well known in his community.

Fallah is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to enlarge his store so he can hire more people who have expertise in his field, and he hopes to gain more profits so he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his electrical supplies store.

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and five daughters. The son works in construction, the youngest daughter studies at school and the other daughters are working in a sewing workshop. A year ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. Nowadays the prices rise sufficiently. Therefore, they can gain a good profit if they run the business efficiently. At the moment, the monthly profit from reselling livestock is about 5,000 soms. This profit made it possible for Ainagul to purchase furniture to improve the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and reselling.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Более 11 лет Одил занимается услугами таксиста на своём районе. Он женат и любящий отей 4 детей. Он любит свою семью и хочет, чтобы они жили, не зная бедности. Одил хочет обеспечить своих детей и устроит их в хороших школах и институтах. Он любит свой бизнес и с удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом. Одил хотел бы получить 10000 Сомони для покупки нового автомобиля. Он надеется, что Кива и Кива кредиторы будут поддерживать его и позволить ему осуществлять его мечту.
texts.en: Odil has been working as a taxi driver in his district for over 11 years. He is married and the loving father of four. He loves his family and wants their lives to be free of poverty. Odil would like to provide for his children and place them in good schools and colleges. He enjoys his business and likes working in it. Odil would like to receive 10,000 TJS to buy a new car. He hopes that Kiva and Kiva lendors will support him and allow him to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to a driver. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons. The older son studies at school and the second is not yet in school; he is preschool age (under seven).  Five years ago, the family sold a good harvest (fruits and vegetables) and with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Nazgul started to sell grocery goods. She sells beverages, cookies, oil, flour, etc. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more products to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future, Nazgul plans to expand the store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour, beverages, oil, etc

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, 28, is a hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the past six years, she has been operating a business selling omena (small fish) to earn a living. She wants to expand her business in the next five years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy omena.

loans.use: to buy omena (small fish)

loans.name: Wifak

texts.en:
Wifak is a 51-year-old single woman, who works hard and is committed to developing her business. She opened a grocery store in 2009. 

Wifak is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new refrigerator and a power engine necessary for developing her business. She has frequent customers to her store and has been a member of Al Majmoua for two cycles with a good standing credit history.

Her previous loan helped a lot in developing her business, and she dreams of expanding her grocery store into a supermarket someday.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator and a power engine necessary for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare land for farming and buying farm inputs

loans.name: Merriapie

texts.en:
Merriapie is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

He has successfully repaid his previous loan from KADET and has now applied for a second loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, and buy more animals. 

He hopes to make a profit that will help in expanding his farm and educating his children. He dreams of having a prosperous farming business and being able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a determined business woman aged 32; she is single and blessed with one child. She has been tailoring to earn a living for the past one year and before that she used to sell clothes. She has grown her business thanks to previous loans from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business and is hence requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: service motorcycles and buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Rail-Way Line United Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Rail-way Line United” group from the eastern city of Kenema. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of 3,700,000 SLL to expand their businesses. 

Mabinty is the leader of the group. She is 23 years old and was born in Yoni village, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children: one is in primary school and the other is not attending school. For many years now, Mabinty has been selling cosmetics, tooth-pastes, soaps, etc. and is requesting this loan to buy these items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, tooth-pastes, soaps, etc. in bulk for her business

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en:
Rawad is 26 years old, married and is father of one child. He has been working in the construction industry for the past eight years and has acquired rich experience. Rawad is a hard working man and seeks perfection in his work and takes on responsibilities of his family.

Rawad is specialized in pasting rocks to walls and ceilings, and his customers recommend him to others because of his good work. This is his first cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower and is requesting a loan to buy necessary tools for improving his business. Rawad works hard to satisfy his customers and hopes to improve his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Akouavi Jeanne

texts.fr:
Akouavi Jeanne est une femme  âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un électricien bâtiment. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Akouavi Jeanne travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2001. Elle vend à ses clients au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits au même lieu. 
Akouavi Jeanne a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
texts.en: Akouavi Jeanne is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a construction electrician and has two children. Akouavi Jeanne has worked as a retailer of traditional pagne cloth since 2001. She sells to her customers at the marketplace in Lomé, where she also purchases her wares. Akouavi Jeanne has requested her second WAGES loan in order to purchase traditional pagne cloth.

loans.use: to purchase traditional pagne cloth (Hitarget and Phoenix brands).

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik is 42 years old and lives in Aknaghbyur village, Tavush region, with his wife and three school-aged children. 

Since 1999 Avetik and his wife have been engaged in farming. They breed cows and chickens as well as grow vegetables on their farm. They use the farm produce and derived dairy products such as eggs, potatoes, cucumber, tomatoes, etc. for family consumption. Avetik grows for sale only figs, which he sells during summer and autumn months for a good profit. 

Avetik has a small, old cowshed on his farm that he wants to convert this into a new and bigger cowshed for his farm animals and is hence asking a 1,000,000 AMD loan.

loans.use: build a new cowshed

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 32-year-old business-man. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. He owns public toilets which earn him a living.  He started the business two years ago. He runs his business in a slum area.  His sanitation facility has improved the cleanliness of his area. Previously, he was selling milk. In the next 5 years, he wants to build rental houses.  He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to build four more public toilets.

loans.use: To build four more public toilets

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un aide comptable. Elle a 02 enfants
Akouvi travaille comme commerçante de plastiques et laitues depuis 2004. Elle vend à ses clients de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Akouvi a requis son  second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des plastiques et des plastiques.
texts.en:
Akouvi, age 27, is married to an assistant accountant and has two children. Since 2004, she's been working as a reseller of plasticware and lettuces. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, and resells them as a traveling saleswoman.

Akouvi is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy plasticware and lettuces.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and plasticware

loans.name: Sandoh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sandoh” group. They are small-scale business people based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 SLL each in order to expand their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sia. Sia, aged 27, was born in a place called Koquma but she is currently residing in Kenema, together with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For 10 years now, Sia has been selling rice, bulgur wheat, gari (food made out of cassava roots), tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned goods in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bulgur wheat, gari, and tomatoes in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man and father of 4 children. He has been working in agriculture for 15 years. Ali plants tobacco. His production is of very good quality as experts claim. Ali also works as a taxi driver. He uses his car for both businesses, transporting people and harvested tobacco to customers. He believes in customer care, and tobacco delivery is one of the best kinds of customer service he can provide.
Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car to replace the old one he has. He will sell the old car and invest the proceeds to add to the requested loan, in order to pay the whole price. This car will improve both business sectors which will reflect positively on his family's social and financial situations.
This is Ali's first experience with Al Majmoua and he hopes it will have a very positive effect on future improvements.

loans.use: To buy a new car necessary for his business

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Sali (Le monsieur en  t-shirt bleu) est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est célibataire. Il a 01 enfant.
 Sali travaille comme revendeur de produits congelés depuis 2003. Il vend à ses clients  dans un marché de la place Il achète les produits à LOME. 
Sali a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés.
texts.en:
Sali (wearing a blue t-shirt in the photograph) is 31 years old, single, and has one child. Since 2003, he's been working as a reseller of frozen goods. He sells to his customers in one of the place's market, and gets his supplies in Lomé.

Sali is seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy frozen products.

loans.use: to buy frozen products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old young man who lives in Bethlehem with the family. He is employed in a stable job and his brother works in a bakery but with a decent salary. Ahmad wants to marry this summer but the amount of money he has to pay for the wedding expenses isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Ahmad takes the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for the wedding expenses and prepare himself well for this occasion. Ahmad appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group Iii

texts.en:
Ibrahim is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ibrahim was born in a place called Koya, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is 55 years of age. Ibrahim is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children who are attending primary school.

For 10 years now, Ibrahim has been selling house-building materials and electrical equipment. Ibrahim and members of his group have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,700,000 SLL in order to expand their respective businesses. Ibrahim is going to use his share of the loan to buy house-building materials and electrical equipment in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials and electrical equipment in large quantities to add to his business

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 39-year-old married man and father of five lovely children. He opened a grocery store three years ago and he's working hard on improving it as much as he can. Haidar is a hardworking man. His store is his only source of living. That's why it has to be going perfectly, to cover all of his family's expanses and at the same time to develop itself.

Haidar is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his tobacco capital in addition to canned products, which are highly requested in the autumn/winter season. That's because most of the villagers stay at home during this season and eat canned food most of the time.

Haidar is a motivated person. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in his business and had a positive impact. This loan will sure to be the same, since he plans exactly what he needs to achieve. 

One of his future plans is to turn his grocery store into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco and canned products for his store

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a 29-year-old single man living with one parent and one sibling. He has owned a barbershop in his village since 2006 and has 12 years of experience working in the same occupation. Like the majority of the Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his business income. With his requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase new chairs and additionA. shaving tools. He is very optimistic and hopes that the loan will positively impact his business.

loans.use: to purchase new chairs and shaving tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth (poplin), containers, raincoats, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children. Over the years, he has earned good experience working as a home painter. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 25 years. He started running his own business in 1991. He works on a freelance basis. His income is very important as he is the main income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional paints and tools for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the customers' demands. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional paint and tools for a new project

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and has three children.

Ali has owned a shop since 2005, selling bedroom furniture and blankets, quilts, linens, towels and mattresses. He chooses this kind of work because it’s profitable and because of his deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and his shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to build a ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can add more inventory and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to make a ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a business lady who is age 37. She is single and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been selling charcoal and fish to bring up her children. Her desire is to own rental houses in five years so as to generate more income. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fish and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy fish and charcoal.

loans.name: Espíritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros del grupo, la cual contactó con una de las asesoras de la Fundación, la cual le explico e instruyó acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, luego de esto ella organizó a un grupo de amigas y vecinas de Ciudad del Este. Actualmente está integrado por 14 mujeres, donde todas ellas trabajan muy a gusto ya en el sexto ciclo del programa dentro de un ambiente de respeto, ayuda y mutua cooperación.
La señora María tiene un salón de belleza, por medio de este negocio que ella explota puede mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Dice que todos los días atiende a muchos clientes y gracias a su buena atención y dedicación puede atraer aun más. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y poder abrir más locales, con los cuales podrá seguir aumentando sus ingresos y además ayudar a otras personas dándoles trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, sprays, juego de tijeras, peinas y demás insumos necesaR. para la peluquería.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members who contacted one of the counselors of the Fundación. She explained and taught about the enterprising women program. Afterwards, she organized a group of friends and neighbors in the Ciudad del Este. At present, it is made up of 14 women and all of them are contentedly in the sixth cycle of the program in an ambience of respect, help and mutual cooperation. 

María has a beauty salon, With this business she is able to support herself and her family. She says that she serves many customers and thanks to her good service and dedication she can attract even more. One of her dreams is to keep growing and be bale to open more locales with which she will be able to increase her income and help other people by giving them work.  

She is asking for the loan to buy dyes, sprays, sets of scissors, combs and other materials necessary for a hair salon.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissor sets, combs and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy batteries, butter, biscuits, etc., wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 47-year-old married man and the father of seven children. Ibrahim has been working in selling electronics since 15 years ago. His business is linked with technology's updates, so he has to be aware of all the new releases.

Ibrahim also sells electronic spare parts, necessary to most people dealing with present day technology.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his electronic products capital through buying machines and tools with updated technology.

Ibrahim experienced Al Majmoua loans for two cycles; his previous loan was a good investment, and he's working hard to improve and develop his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase his electronic products with updated technology.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 36-year-old Lebanese single man living with his father. He started working as a car mechanic at a very young age in order to support his father financially. And in 1996, this man opened his own car repair shop. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing a scanner machine to be able to serve more customers in less time. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes to further expand his business and gain a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner machine

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en: Elvis is a hardworking businessman age 27. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last three years, he has been managing a salon and selling cosmetics to earn a living. He has employed three people in his business. In the next five years, he wants to buy a piece of land. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy make-up and hair chemicals. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy make-up and hair chemicals

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en: Ammar is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child who is attending school. He has 10 years of experience working as a farmer; and in 2006, he started running his own business. He grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. These agricultural tents allow him to better monitor his product’s quality throughout the year. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to install new plastic tents on his farm. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to install new plastic tents on his farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry in large quantities

loans.name: Awah

texts.en:
She was born in January 1981. She is married and has two children. Both of these children are below 15 years of age. She lives with her family in a three-room apartment in Mile 90 Nsongwa, Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Poverty, death and sickness are the major challenges she has faced in her life.

She joint GHAPE in 2009 and has taken and repaid an Empowerment Credit only once. She invested her last loan in her retail business. She bought goods like cabbages, vegetables and carrots and carried them to the South West Region where she sold them. She used the proceeds from this business to sponsor her children in school and to buy her big pot. Given a loan, she will invest it in her retail business. She will buy 10 bags of cabbages, 10 bags of huckleberries, 3 bags of carrots and some dry fish. She believes she will succeed because she has many years of experience and because she handles her business with a lot of seriousness.

With the profit from this business, she will sponsor her children in school and buy some of her house needs. She prefers a GHAPE loan because she likes the repayment method.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, huckleberries, peppers, carrots and smoked fish

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 45-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last 10 years, she has been managing a cafeteria to make a living. Previously, she was practicing dairy farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented. Her desire is to expand her business in five years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old married man and father of eight children. Ahmad is a hard working man who spent his whole life working hard to provide his family with secure and healthy living. Ahmad has worked in transportation for twenty years. He owns a bus that is specialized for transporting students from/to school. He is well known in the region, and most of his children help him transport students to provide him with special extra days off.

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance to his bus to keep it in the best shape and service as it should be. He hopes to increase the number of buses he owns, by buying new modern ones and opening a special school bus company in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. Two of his children are still attending school. Despite his older age, he is still working in the construction field. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 25 years. And in 1990, he started to work independently, sticking with multiple construction projects and individual works. He is specialized at completing floor covering work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Mutuku

texts.en: Mutuku is a businessman who is 44 years old. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last seven years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He has improved the business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand the business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to service his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 33 years old and married to Simon Mbugua. They work together in the carpentry business located at Githurai 45. They have three children who are school going. They get a monthly income of 20,000 KES from the business. She has been in the business for the past six years.

This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy more timber. Anticipated profits will help her expand her business and educate her children. She hopes to develop her business to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. He has 14 years of experience working in the construction field. After gaining the needed experience, he decided to start working on a freelance basis managing houses in his village and its surroundings. He is a very hard-working person specializing in wall foliage work. Today, Mahmoud is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood for his work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening a construction office and working directly with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his work

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a businesswoman who is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. For one year, she has been selling clothes to make a living. Through her hard work and determination, she has retained the business. In the next five years, she wants to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income and access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine Mbithe is 36 years old and married to Kimani Warma. Together they have three children who are 12, 5 and 3 years old. Her primary business is a food kiosk located In Tala. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. This gives her a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans, flour, sugar, salt and firewood, helping her to increase her stock. 

Her anticipated profits will help her improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to have more income-generating businesses and a well-supported family through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as maize, beans, flour, and firewood

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and father to three girls.

Mohamad is an owner of a food market, selling sweets, soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products; he inherited his market from his father. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $1,500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his market

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 29-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon living with her only child who is still attending school. She has 10 years of experience working as a female hairdresser. In 2008, this woman was able to open her own female beauty salon. She works so hard to gain good income to be able to support her only child and pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase hairdressing tools and additional beauty products. In the future, she is planning to further expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married man who has worked in electronic repairs for 10 years. Ali is a talented person who is specialized in repairing TVs. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles. His previous loans directly affected his career and family positively.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new tools and do the necessary decoration to his shop to attract new customers, as he states. Ali's business is highly requested in his region since most of the citizens can't afford new TVs or electronic machines at any time, so most of them seek to repair what they have before looking to buy new. He hopes to expand his business in the future to achieve a new sector for selling new electronic machines, in addition to doing the maintenance.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers from his general store.

loans.name: We Yone Group

texts.en: Salone Micronfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to introduce you to this group of entrepreneurs from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. The people you see here have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, for a loan of 800,000 SLL to expand their businesses. The leader of the group is Abibatu, who earns a living by selling rice, wheat, tomatoes, soap, spices, salt, palm oil and other items to her customers. She was born in Kenema city and is 37 years old, married to a businessman and has four children, all of whom are in school. Abibatu is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 years old, married,  and has two children.  She is a hardworking business woman who sells clothes to make a living. She has been in this business for 14 years. Alice has expanded her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management. Her desire is to further expand her business within five years. Alice is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy clothes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional filters to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is 43 years old and married with three children in Iraq. He owns a store that sells structural materials and, based on the region’s needs, he added foodstuffs to his store in 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $3,000 loan in order to pay his annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can one day open a new store to make the food market separate from his other work and to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay his annual rent and add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory

loans.name: Masese

texts.en: Masese is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a hardworking business woman who runs a photocopy and printing business.  She has been in this business for one year.  Masese also owns a van, which she uses for transport business to earn additional income.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business to generate more income. Masese is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES, which will use to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en: Houssam is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver for the past 15 years. His main service route is between his town and the surrounding areas. He also provides private transportation services. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his car including improving the car’s body and updating the paint. He states that these improvements will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his business income.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Astou Mbene

texts.fr: soutien de famille, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vend des poissons seches, de l'huile de palme et d'autres produits de ce genre. Marchant ambulante, elle s'active depuis plus de trois ans dans ce domaine. Puis qu'etand soutien de famille, ce prêt lui permettrait d'augmenter son fond de roulement et de participer activement aux dépenses quotidien de la famille. Vivant dans une ville qui est au Sénégal, cette marchande veut tout faire pour améliorer la conditions de vie de ses enfants afin de leur offrir une bonne éduquation et un bon cadre de vie.
texts.en: A married woman and mother of three children living in Senegal, Astou sells dried fish, palm oil and other general food products of this type. She has been a traveling salesperson for the past three years. This loan will allow her to increase the working capital of her business, thus enabling her to support her family by taking care of their daily expenses. She is very keen on improving the living conditions of her children and would like to offer them a strong education and a good life.

loans.use: increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  He grows wheat and is also a livestock trader. He is requesting his third loan to buy farm inputs and more livestock, which would allow him to expand his business and increase the number of animals he owns. 

Gideon has been a good client who repaid all his previous loans on time.  His goal is to work hard to support his family, and above all to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ihssan

texts.en: Ihssan is 21 years old and single. He lives with four family members in Iraq. Ihssan has owned a food store since 2008 selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting loan of $3,000 to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floors and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floors and walls.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en: Haitham is a 22-year-old single man living with one parent and two siblings. He has been working as a painter since 2005. He works with multiple projects and has two part-time employees helping him with the work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase scaffolding and renew his business tools. He reports that these purchases will enable him to provide his services to more customers and take on more projects.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and renew his business tools

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 59 years, married, and has three adult children. His primary business is supplying potatoes at the busy Mulolongo market. He has been in this business for three years.  John's earns a monthly income of 36,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET By KADET officer.
	
This is John's third loan from KADET, which he will use to purchase potatoes for resale. He paid his previous loans on time.

John's anticipated profit will be used to purchase a pickup for transportation. His dream is to have a big store, buy potatoes from upcountry, and sell at Nairobi Gikomba market.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for resale

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is 53 years old and married with four children in Iraq. He has owned a workshop since 2008, where he sells spare parts for cars. He has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He also has a good reputation and is well known in his area. He decided to apply for $2,200 loan in order to renovate the ceiling of his workshop. Kamel is aiming to gain more profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate the ceiling of his workshop.

loans.name: Mayramkul

texts.ru:
Майрамкуль родилась в селе Куланак (северная часть Кыргызстана) в простой семье фермера. Окончив школу и получив профессию товароведа, она стала работать продавцом в местном магазине. В 1970 году, Майрамкуль вышла замуж и постепенно стала матерью 6 детей – 3 сыновей и 3 дочек.   
В 1991 году, семья Майрамкуль решает переехать в Чуйскую область, в с. Красная Речка. 
В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  1996 году Майрамкуль решает завести хозяйство, таким образом положив начало бизнесу в разведении скота. Полная отдача сил  и неустанный труд помогли Майрамкуль развить свой бизнес, доходы от которого в сумме около  4,000 сом (KGS)ежемесячно позволили дать хорошее приданое своим дочерям и помочь сыновьям обзавестись своими собственными семьями. 
В данное время с ней проживает ее младший сын Тилек, он вместе с отцом помогает матери по хозяйству.
На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Майрамкуль имеется 1 корова и 1 теленок. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Майрамкуль обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).    
Майрамкуль мечтает со временем женить младшего сына и помочь ему построить дом.
texts.en: Mayramkul was born in the Kulanak village (northern part of Kyrgyzstan) into a simple family of a farmer.  After finishing school and getting a profession of a merchandiser, she started working as a salesperson at a local store.  Mayramkul got married in 1970 and gradually became a mother of six children - three sons and three daughters.  Mayramkul's family decided to move to the Krasnaya Rechka village in the Chuysk region in 1991.  In order to find an income source for her family, Mayramkul decided to start her own business of breeding livestock in 1996.  Full output of effort and hard work helped Mayramkul to develop her business; monthly income of about 4,000 som (KGS) allowed her to provide her daughters with good dowries and to help her sons have their own families.  Currently, her youngest son Tilek lives with Mayramkul and, together with his father, help his mother with the business.  Today, Mayramkul has one cow and one calf.  In order to increase her livestock headcount, Mayramkul requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from "Bai-Tushum and Partners".  Mayramkul dreams to eventually marry off her youngest son and help him build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, a 48-year-old married father of three children, has owned and operated with the help of his wife a small restaurant since 2005. Hussein sells chicken and Falafel sandwiches, the latter of which "can be served as veggie burgers too since they have the same shape but instead of meat, pork, fish or chicken, they are made of ground broad beans and chickpeas with special herbs and spices to provide a special flavor". His customers can be both local villagers and foreigners passing through to other villages.

Working hard on improving his business, Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a grill and a freezer for his restaurant. The grill will help him cook special chicken sandwiches with various flavors, and the freezer will help to preserve the freshness of his Falafel mixture for several days.

Hussein's plans for expansion including enlarging his restaurant in order to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to buy a grill and a freezer for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a proud owner of a car repair shop. He has been working in the car mechanics field for more than 40 years. He is a married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He works hard to support his family and be able to pay mainly the school fees. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a specific mechanical machine which will allow him to better serve his customers. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase a specific mechanical machine

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en: Rabiha is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is living with her husband and only child who is attending school. After having her first child, she decided to help her husband with the household expenses. So she started to work as a private teacher in her home. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to prepare a special education room outfitted with the needed teaching materials and supplies to welcome students appropriately. She notes that she will also need the loan to pay her daughter’s school fees to allow her to pursue her education properly. She is very positive and willing to apply for additional Kiva loans in the future.

loans.use: to prepare a special education room and pay her daughter’s school fees

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 50, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Bienvinido, 53, a carpenter, and is a mother to two children who are already working. By the grace of God and with the help of her supportive husband, she was able to provide for her children’s needs and schooling.

Lolita runs a piggery. She buys several piglets, raises and fattens them, and sells them at their mature age and size. Her usual buyers are owners of meat stalls and slaughterhouses who sell the cut meat per kilo. The price of fattened hog is reasonably high and can cover all her expenses from buying piglets, feeds, and the cost of labor. From this, Lolita earns approximately PHP 730 a day.      

To help her continue running her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed so she can supply to more meat stall and slaughterhouse owners. She also expects that it can compensate for some losses due to common hog diseases. As her business gets bigger, she anticipates a boost in her business income and she is looking forward to improved living conditions.

Lolita hopes to expand her piggery and raise more piglets so she can contribute a little to the food crisis in urban poor communities. She can supply more pork meat in the community and compete with the commercialized pork dealers. In this way, she can make her meat price more affordable for her neighbors and friends. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and piglets

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only child. He has owned a taxi for the past six years. Despite his older age, Ahmad must proceed with his business operation because he is the sole income provider of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make much-needed repairs to his car such as repairing the engine, repainting it, etc. In the future, Ahmad is planning to hire a full-time employee to act on his behalf since he is planning to give up work because of his age.

loans.use: to make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a focused businessman who is 55 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. For over 10 years, he has been selling sand to earn a living. He has employed three people to help him to manage the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand.

loans.use: To buy sand to sell

loans.name: Juan Edwin

texts.es: El Señor Juan es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene su negocio en el mercado que existe por la zona, que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (verduras, papa, cebolla, tomate), entre otros, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de estos productos, para así abastecer mejor su negocio y a sus clientes. Su gran su gran sueño es culminar sus estudios en la universidad la carrera de Ingenieria de Alimentos que viene estudiando, y a la vez tener su local propio para implementar mejor su puesto de trabajo. El Señor Juan está muy agradecido por el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is single and lives at the home of his parents. He has a business at the local market where he sells basic staples (vegetables, potatoes, onions, tomatoes) and other products.

The loan is he is requesting will be used to buy more of these products so that he can restock his business and serve his customers. His greatest wish is to finish his studies at the university where he is obtaining a degree in Food Science. He hopes to have his own location where he can better operate his business. Sr. Juan is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions in order to restock his business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a hardworking businessman who is 31 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, he has been selling frying pans and stoves to bring up his family. He also operates a retail shop for more income. In the next five years, he wants to operate a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy frying pans and stoves.

loans.use: To buy frying pans and stoves.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en: Penninah is 27 years old, married to Enoch Nzau who is a businessman. Together they have two children aged seven and four years who are both in school. She owns a shop as her primary business which gives her a monthly income of 16,500 KES. Her business is located at Bissil market where her customers are residents of the area. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is Penninah's third loan from KADET. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She repaid her previous loans successfully. Her extra profit will be used to open a wholesale shop, which she hopes to do in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat for her store

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en: Souheir is a 24-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her father. She has owned a tailoring shop since 2007 and has more than five years of experience in silimar work. She specializes in sewing clothes and stitching designs onto them. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase textiles and pearls in order to increase her productivity and expand her business operation to earn more profit. This will be her second Kiva loan and we note that she has been a very good client with payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and pearls

loans.name: Shirinbay

texts.ru:
Ширинбай родился в селе Карл Маркс (Ошская область, Кыргызская Республика). Женат и имеет 4 детей.
Ширинбай родился в простой семье чабана. Он был самым старшим из братьев, и поэтому большую часть времени посвящал домашним хлопотам, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом. Окончив школу, в 1979 году его призвали в армию, где отслужил два года. Отслужив, Ширинбай поступил в Сельхоз техникум в городе Ош, по специальности технолог зерновых производств и в этом же году женился.
Первое время жил с родителями, в родном селе  устроился на работу в колхоз. В 1991 году накопив немного денег, Ширинбай покупает небольшой дом в селе Кара-Добо (Панфиловский р-он, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). На выделенной им колхозом земле они выращивали овощи и содержали небольшое хозяйство. Постепенно семья Ширинбая росла, росли потребности, и было решено  переехать в село Новониколаевка, так как это село находится вблизи города Карабалта (Жайылский р-он, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан), который является центром района. Постепенно хозяйство разрасталось. На доходы от продажи приплода и молока Ширинбай купил себе автомашину, на которой по сей день предоставляет населению услуги такси. Так же на доходы от животноводства, Ширинбай выдал замуж дочь, женил двух старших сыновей и помог купить одному из них дом по соседству.
В данное время, благодаря предприимчивости и упорству Ширинбая в хозяйстве насчитывается 20 дойных коров. Для дальнейшего  увеличения поголовья скота, Ширинбай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  В будущем, Ширинбай мечтает со временем женить младшего сына и собирать всю свою дружную семью с внуками за одним большим  столом в своем доме.
texts.en: Shirinbay was born in the Karl Marx village (Osh region, Kyrgyz Republic).  He is married and has four children.  Shirinbay was born into a simple family of a shepherd.  He was the oldest among his brothers and, thus, devoted the most time taking care of the household and helped his father to take care of livestock.  After finishing school, he was drafted into the army in 1979, where he served two years.  After the army, Shirinbay went to the agricultural college in the city of Osh to learn the profession of a grain production technologist.  He also got married that same year.  At first, he lived with his parents in his native village and got a job in the agricultural collective.  Having saved some money, Shirinbay bought a small house in the Kara-Dobo village (Panfilovsk district, Chuysk region, Kyrgyzstan) in 1991.  The family grew vegetables and kept livestock on the land allotted to them by the collective farm.  As Shirinbay's family grew, so did their needs, and they decided to move to the Novonikolaevka village because it is located near the city of Karabalta (Jayilsk district, Chuysk region, Kyrgyzstan), which is the center of the district.  Their business gradually developed.  Shirinbay used the profits from selling livestock litter and milk to buy himself a car, which he uses to this day to provide people with a taxi service.  Also using income from animal husbandry, Shirinbay married off his daughter, two older sons and helped one of them to buy a house nearby.  Currently, thanks to Shirinbay's entrepreneurship and persistence, his business has 20 dairy cows.  In order to continue increasing livestock headcount, Shirinbay requested a loan in the of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  In the future, Shirinbay dreams to eventually marry off his youngest son and bring his friendly family with grandchildren together at one big table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nelliency

texts.en:
Nelliency is a 35 year old married lady blessed with children. She operates a tailoring business at Malindi. She has been in the business for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.10, 000. 


Nelliency has applied for KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, her second loan cycle. With this loan, she intends to buy more material for making dresses. 

She will use the anticipated profit to sustain her business and help look after her family. In future, she hopes to own a tailoring school and a well-stocked boutique.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 31 years old, married to David Cheruyiot, who is in the army. Together they have three children aged 11, nine, and six years. She owns a taxi as her primary business at the Kahawa barracks area. This gives her a monthly income of 17,000 KES. This is her second loan in KADET. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. The loan will help her purchase needed spare parts and to service the car. Florence will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and set up more businesses. Her dream is to buy five cars of her own and have a fleet of cars for hire.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service her car

loans.name: Cephas

texts.en: Cephas is 32 years old, married to Grace Omusolo and together they have two children. His primary business is dressmaking. He has been in the sector for the past three years. His monthly income from the business is 6,000 KES. The business is located in Mathare slum. This is his first loan in KADET which he intends to use to purchase more clothing material. Anticipated profit is to be used to expand the business and educate his children. His hopes are to build his own house and venture into the hotel industry.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is married to Catherine Nyokabi. Together they have two children who are in school. He owna a taxi at Githurai 44. He has been in the business for the past 10 years. His monthly income is 30,000 KES. This is his second loan in KADET. He repaid the earlier loan successfully. He intends to use the loan to buy another vehicle. The anticipated profits will help him educate his children and improve his family`s living standard. His ambition is to buy more taxis and buy a plot of land and develop it.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle

loans.name: Marcie

texts.en: Marcie is 45 years old. She has six children, who are between the ages of five and fifteen years old. She owns a bar in which she sells beer. She has been selling beer for the past six years, and this business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more beer and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more glasses for resale.

loans.name: Fatou Barro

texts.fr: Commercante depuis plus de 5 ans, elle vend des tissus, draps et maillots.. Habitant dans une région proche de la capitale du Sénégal, cette commercante a besoin de ce crédit pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaires afin d'acheter des marchandises destinée a la revente. Lutilité de ce crédit lui permettrait aussi d'avoir du profits pour subvenir a ces besoins et la réalition de son projet d'ouverture d'une cantine pour étre fixe et avoir plus de confort dans la vente et étre visible.
texts.en: Fatou has been a storekeeper for the last five years, selling cloth, sheets and bathing suits.
