She lives in a region near the capital of Senegal, and is asking for a loan in order to increase the number of transactions she undertakes and thus purchase more merchandise to sell. This loan will also allow her to receive profits that, in addition to covering her daily expenses, will allow her to realize her dream: opening a fixed cafeteria that would also be a place from which she could sell her products with greater visibility and comfort.

loans.use: sell cloth, sheets and bathing suits

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette is 32 years old and has a six-year-old child. She has owned and run her restaurant for seven years. This restaurant has enabled her meet the needs of her family and pay her child’s school fees. Colette needs a loan to buy food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food to stock her restaurant.

loans.name: Sarina

texts.es: La señora Sarina se dedica a la venta de lechón de cerdo al horno y pollo al horno los días jueves y domingos en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto. Los días restantes desempeña la función  como farmacéutica en una farmacia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material, como ladrillo refractario para la reparación de su horno que lo usa para su negocio de venta de comida. Vive en casa de sus suegros , ubicada en la zona de 16 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto. La señora Sarina tiene un hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene prestamos con impro y la primera con kiva.
texts.en: Sarina sells roasted piglet and roasted chicken on Thursdays and Sundays at the market in the city of El Alto.  On the rest of the days she works as a pharmacist in a pharmacy.  She needs the loan to buy materials, like a refractory brick, to repair her oven that she uses in her food sales business.  She lives in her in-laws’ house located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio neighborhood.  Sarina has one son and this is the second time she has loans with Impro and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair her oven.

loans.name: Nforneh

texts.en:
After joining GHAPE in 2007, things gradually improved in N.'s life. She has received and successfully repaid three Empowerment Credit loans. She invested these loans in her poultry, restaurant, and bar business. She used the profit from these loans to educate her grandchildren and to increase her capital.

Given a loan of 200,000 FRS, she intends to buy fowl for her poultry farm, buy drinks for her bar, and to buy firewood and stock some provisions. She strongly believes that this business will be a success because she has done it for a very long time and has a lot of experience with it. Other reasons for success are that she sells at a moderate price and has enough customers. The site of the business is also very good. Her business activity will be of great help to her community in that it will create an employment opportunity for N. and others, it will make some goods available for people around her, and will also improve people’s eating habits.

With the proceeds from her business, she will feed and clothe her family and also increase her capital. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the training she receives, the low interest rates, and also because no collateral security is required before loans are disbursed. The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy fowl, drinks, firewood, red oil, and other provisions.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Miguel, se conformó en el año 2010, mediante la promoción de una de las miembros, quien le comentó a las vecinas sobre el programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  logró juntar a 10 mujeres en principio, todas ellas trabajadoras de la zona. Actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro del tercer ciclo del programa de la Fundación.
La señora Julia tiene una pequeña despensa mediante la cual puede mantener a su familia, gracias a este negocio ella ha logrado salir adelante e ir creciendo poco a poco. Comenta que uno de sus sueños es poder ir ampliando su despensa y llegar algún día a tener un pequeño supermercado.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás artículos para la posterior venta, con lo cual podrá abastecer su local y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Women's Committee named San Miguel was formed in 2010, through the development of one of its members. She told the neighbors about the Enterprising Women's Committee. She was able to get 10 women together at first. All of them work in the area. At present they are very pleased to be in their third cycle with the Fundación's program.

Julia has a small store with which she supports her family. Thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead and grow little by little. She remarks that one of her dreams is to have a small supermarket.

She is asking for a loan to buy edibles, beverages, dairy products and other items to sell. With this she will be able to stock her store and offer more variety to her customers. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity that it has given her. Getting the loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy edibles, bevergaes, dairy products and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old. She is a widow with five children who all go to school. Her primary business, besides running a salon, is transportation. She has been in this business for twelve years. Her businesses give her a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This is her second loan from KADET; she paid off her earlier loan successfully. This loan will help her repair her bus and van. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her kids. Her dream is to expand her business by purchasing another bus.

loans.use: to repair her bus and van.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos es empleado en una fábrica industrializadora de productos lácteos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que el cliente esta estudiando en la universidad. Vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la zona de Alto Lima en la ciudad de El Alto; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito a través de IMPRO y Kiva.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is an employee at an industrial dairy products processing plant.  He needs the loan to buy a computer because he’s also a university student.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Alto Lima zone.  He’s single and has no children.  This is the first time he’s gotten a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use in his university classes.

loans.name: Unión Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN” iniciará su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Faustina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de batidos, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de periódicos, venta de carne, confección de deportivos.

La señora Faustina,  indica que este es el sexto año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de su sobrina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos que viene trabajando desde hace seis años, el que aprendió de su hija.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azucar y bicervecina), que comprara de las ferias y lo venderá en los colegios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud, el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union" is starting its 6th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Santiago II central office.  This group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by Faustina.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses such as the sale of: milkshakes, clothing, vegetables, newspapers, meat and also the production of sportswear. 

Faustina states that this is her 6th year working with Pro Mujer, which she joined at the recommendation of her niece.  Now she has had a milk shake business for 6 years, a business that she learned from her daughter.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her capital to purchase sugar and bicervecina (a non-alcoholic malt beverage.)  She will buy these products in the market, and she will sell her milkshakes at the schools.  This type of work allows her to generate resource so that she can support her family as best she can.  She is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health care services, the loans and the savings accounts.

loans.use: to buy sugar and "bicervecina"

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 59 years old, and married to Wambua Kitavi who is 60 years old. Together they have four children aged 18, 20, 26 and 27, who are all in business. Quarrying is her primary business--she has been in this business for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of 25,900 KES. She also has some rental houses. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client.

This is her first loan which she intends to use to purchase an extra quarry and build more rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase a piece of land to build more rental houses. Her dream is to become, through her hard work, the best quarry supplier in the whole Kitengela area.

loans.use: To purchase another quarry and also build more rental houses.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda tiene un puesto de venta de comida. El crédito lo requiere para aumentar capital y comprar al por mayor productos como ser arroz, fideo. papa, carne y verduras. Esta actividad de venta de comida es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa propia  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos. Yolanda se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente y pudo mejorar sus ingresos. Es cliente  de IMPRO desde el año  2010.
texts.en:
Yolanda has a food stand.  She needs the loan to increase her capital and buy such products as rice, noodles, potatoes, meat and vegetables at wholesale.  This food selling activity is the source of income she has to cover her expenses. 

 She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Copacabana zone.  She’s divorced and has three children.  

Yolanda is very satisfied with the loans she got previously and was able to improve her income.  She’s been an IMPRO client since 2010.

loans.use: to buy such supplies as rice, noodles, meat, vegetables and potatoes for her food stand.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto tiene una tienda donde vende ropa para tota edad; también vende su mercadería los días jueves y domingos en la feria de la 16 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar al por mayor chamarras para dama, pues es un artículo que se vende mucho. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. Roberto se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente ya que pudo aumentar su capital y  así mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita el crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Roberto has a store where he sells clothes for all ages.  He also sells his merchandise on Thursdays and Sundays at the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto.  

He needs the loan to buy women’s jackets at wholesale because this is an item that sells quite a bit.  This activity is his source of income to cover his expenses.  

He lives in his parents’ house that is located in the city of La Paz’s Pampahasi zone.  He’s married and has a son.

Roberto is very satisfied with the loans he got previously because he was able to increase capital and improve income.  This is his second loan request through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy women's jackets.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijas que le han ayudado a salir adelante en este negocio, una de sus hijas estudia en la universidad y la menor se encuentra en la etapa escolar. La Señora tiene un pequeño negocio que se dedica a la venta de comidas (almuerzos principalmente). El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ingredientes que son utilizados en la preparación de sus comidas (almuerzo y venta de desayunos que desea implementar en su negocio). Eligió este trabajo porque desde muy pequeña le fascinaba el arte de cocinar, además porque vio la necesidad de hacerlo. Su gran sueño de la Señora Nelly es tener un gran restaurante, que sus hijas culminen sus estudios y sean unas grandes profesionales. Está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que podrá incrementar su negocio y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Nelly is a single mother who has 2 daughters who have helped her get ahead in her business. One of her daughters goes to college and the youngest is school aged. Nelly has a small business where she sells meals (mostly lunches). The loan she has asked for is to buy ingredients used to prepare the meals  (lunches and breakfasts, which she wants to add to her business). She chose this work because since she was very young she has been fascinated by the art of cooking. She also needed to do it. Nelly's biggest dream is to have a great restaurant, for her daughters to finish their studies and to have great carreers. She is very grateful for the loan, since she can grow her business and have more income.

loans.use: to buy products used to prepare meals (lunches and breakfasts that she wants to add to her business)

loans.name: Jose Favian

texts.es:
Jose Favian tiene 31 años es soltero, vive con un hijo de un año de edad. Vive en el Canton Chillanes Perteneciente a la Provincia Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece a la Parroquia San Jose del Tambo, en esta ventanilla son socios 24 personas que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, soya platano, yuca y naranja.

Jose Favian se dedica a la agricultura tiene cultivos de acao, arroz, soya, platano, yuca y naranja.Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El credtito lo solica para invertir en huertos de cacao, en comprar de abonos y fertilizantes, el credito le ayudara a dar mejor mantenimiento a los cuiltivos y tener una mejor cosecha. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de lluvia en los terrenos. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Jose Favian is 31. He is single and lives with his one-year-old child. He lives in the Chillanes Canton, belonging to the Bolivar Province.

His communal bank is called El Placer and is located 60 minutes from the office. It belongs to the San Jose del Tambo Parish. There are 24 members, all farmers who sow cocoa, rice, soy, plantains, yucca and oranges.

Jose Favian is a farmer who has cocoa, rice, soy, plantain, yucca and orange crops. He makes his purchases in San Jose del Tambo and his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

He is requesting this loan for investing in cocoa crops, through buying manure and fertilizer. This loan will help him to maintain his crops and have a better harvest. He confronts challenges such as lack of rainfall. His dream is to have his own home.

In his free time he enjoys going for walks with his son.

loans.use: to invest in cocoa crops.

loans.name: Ana Elizabet

texts.es:
L.  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en L. Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

L.  socia Ana Elizabet; tiene 32 años de edad,  L. socia es conviviente; L. socia tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad;  L. socia es comerciante minorista, L. socia tiene su stand en un centro comercial muy conocido en L. ciudad del Cusco, elL. alquiL. este stand y se dedica  a L. venta de colchas de lanas para bebes y adultos, L. socia también hace chompas, guantes, chalinas, gorros, medias, chalecos, mantas y todo con finas lanas peruanas y en los diseños que se desee. L. socia desea en un futuro poder tener su  distribuidora de chompas hechas  a mano para L. venta a las grandes tiendas comerciales y tener su marca. L. socia por el momento desea invertir el préstamo en L. compra de lanas al por mayor para poder realizar sobre todo sus trabajo de colchas para bebes y colchas en general realizadas en pastillaje para cubrir las camas de 1 plaza y de 2 plazas también. L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra de lanas al por mayor y en varios colores y grosores. 

L.  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” communal bank, located in the Cachimayo district, in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Ana Elizabet is 32. She lives with her partner and they have two children ages 11 and 7. She is a retailer and has a stand in a very well-known shopping center in Cusco. She rents this stand and sells woolen bedspreads for babies and adults. She also sells sweaters, gloves, scarves, caps, stockings, cardigans, and blankets. All of these products are made of fine Peruvian wool and are her designs. She wants to have a wholesale distributor for her hand-made sweaters so that she can focus on her baby blankets and blankets in general. She makes them for single and double beds using appliqué. She is requesting this loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of wool of various colours and sizes.

She is grateful for the support that you are providing and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the wholesale purchase of wool of various colours and sizes.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Cachimayo, en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Bernardina; tiene  57 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos D. 23 y 20 años D. edad; La socia trabaja en el poblado D. cachimayo desD. hace muchos años y en las tardes a partir D. las 4 D. la tarD. la socia venD.  salchipapas, ella tiene un puesto D. salchipapas, estas se preparan a base D. salchichas y papas fritas, la socia trabaja hasta las 9.30 D. la noche; ella también se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, ella cría pollos y gallinas. La socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. papa y salchichas para incrementar el negocio.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to " Solidaridad-Cachimayo", the bank is located in the District of Cachimayo in the Urubamba province and department of Cusco.

Bermardina is 57 years old, she is married, and has 2 children of ages 23 and 20. She has been working in the village of Cachimayo for several years and starting at 4pm she sells "salchipapas". She has a stand selling "salchipapas", they are prepared with hot dogs and fried potatoes and she works until 9:30PM.  She also works raising small animals like chicks and hens.  On this occasion the member need the loan to invest in the purchase of potatoes and hot dogs in order to increase business.

The member is thankful for the assistance being offered and as such, she commits to fulfill her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest towards the purchase of potatoes and hot dogs in order to increase business.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Visitacion; tiene 60 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 7 hijos  los cuales son todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, chanchos los cuales compra, cría y vende, la socia también tiene un par de vacas, ahora ella desea  empezar a invertir en la compra de ganados vacunos, para la crianza, reproducción y venta final. La socia es una señora muy carismática y trabajadora, ella desea seguir en actividad y con la ilusión de comprar sus vacas para la venta de los derivados y la reproducción de sus ganados, ella quiere dejarles a sus hijos el ejemplo de que no hay edad para hacer los sueños realidad, ella soñó en tener una buena cantidad considerable de cabezas de ganados vacunos, lo que significa  tener  en su casa vacas como mínimo un numero de 10, y criarlas, alimentarlas y hacerlas procrear y ese fue su sueño. La socia ahora solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vacas terneras.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cachimayo, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member, Visitación, is 60 years old, married and has 7 children, all of whom are adults. She works raising young animals, like chickens, and pigs which she buys, raises and sells. She also has a pair of cows and now she wants to begin buying cattle to riase, reproduce and in the end, sell.

Visitación is a very charismatic and hardworking woman. She wants to continue doing this work, with the dream of buying cows in order to breed them and sell their offspring. She wants to leave her children with the example that old age does not prevent one’s dreams from coming true. She dreamed of having a large number of heads of cattle, which means having a minimum of 10 at her house, raising them, feeding them, breeding them and that was her dream. She is currently requesting the loan to invest in female calves.

Visitación is grateful for the support provided her and is committed to making her payments on time

loans.use: to buy female calves.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia trabaja como personal de limpieza en una fábrica; además, se dedica a la venta de productos de peluquería. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital para la compra de: peinetas, sujetadores de cabello, maquillaje, cremas, para su venta en las peluquerías de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en  anticrítico en una casa,  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Miraflores en la ciudad de La Paz. Delia es viuda y tiene dos  hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia works as part of the cleaning staff at a factory. In addition, she sells beauty salon products. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital for buying combs, hair clips, makeup, and crèmes that she can sell to beauty salons in the city of La Paz. Delia lives in a rented house located in the District of Alto Miraflores in the city of La Paz. She is a widow and has two children.

This is the first time her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

loans.use: to buy combs, hair clips, makeup, and crèmes.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
L.  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en L. Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

L.  socia Basilia; tiene 42 años de edad,  L. socia es conviviente; L. socia tiene 3 hijos  de 20, 6, 5 años de edad;  L. socia es comerciante minorista, L. socia tiene dos facetas de ventas, elL. ofrece sus productos de belleza en catálogos, una vez que le hacen el pedido esperan a que llegue los productos, luego los reparte le dan una parte del precio del producto, y L. otra parte le dan a fines del mes, por otro lado elL. viaja a Ayaviri a unas tres horas de L. ciudad del Cusco y trae docenas de moldes de queso, los cuales los reparte a los diferentes restaurantes y el precio del queso si le pagan de inmediato con L. excepción de algunos clientes que ya gozan de su confianza y les deja para el pago en un par de semanas. L. socia con este monto que ingresa a casa elL. puede ahorrar para pagar las mensualidades de sus tres hijos en sus respectivos colegios y universidad, y compra víveres para el hogar, el conyugue apoya en el pago de los servicio y de L. casa, en cubrir algunas veces los estudios y útiles también de este modo los dos ingresos se complementan bien, L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra de quesos al por mayor para L. venta.

L.  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the Solidaridad-Cachimayo Community Bank located in the district of Cachimayo, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco.

Basilia is 42 years old and married with three children aged 20, 6, and 5. She is a businesswoman with two jobs.  She sells beauty products from catalogs. Once her customers have put in an order and the products have arrived, Basilia delivers them and is given part of the cost of the item. Then she receives the rest of the money at the end of the month.

Basilia also travels to Ayaviri, some three hours from Cusco, and brings back dozens of cheeses which she distributes to various restaurants. Most of them pay her for the cheeses immediately, with the exception of some trustworthy customers who pay her a couple of weeks later. 

With the income from these two jobs, Basilia pays the fees for her three children in their respective schools and universities and buys groceries for the home. Her husband contributes to the costs of services and household expenses, and sometimes to their children's studies and educational supplies. In this way their two incomes cover their expenses. 

Basilia is grateful for the support that is offered and promises to make the loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy cheeses at wholesale prices for resale

loans.name: Julio Omario

texts.es:
Julio Omario tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Julio se dedica a la siembra de cacao, soya y a la crianza de chanchos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de chancho y para comprar de alimento para ellos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la alimentacion de chancho y asi tener mejor ganancia. Enfrentan desafios por la competencia en precios. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y construir una vivienda.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
28-year old Julio Omario is single and has no children. He lives alone in Chillanes Canton, in the province of Bolivar.

His community bank is called El Placer and is part of Chillanes Canton, in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, located 60 minutes from the main office. In this branch there are 24 members, all of whom work in agriculture. They grow bananas, rice, yucca, cocoa, soya, and oranges. As well they raise animals.

Julio grows cocoa and soya, and also raises pigs and then sells them. He buys them in San Jose del Tambo, and sells them in Chillanes market on Sundays. 

He is seeking a loan to buy pigs and feed. The money will help him to improve the quality of the food he gives the pigs and thus earn more profit when he sells them. The biggest problem he faces is the number of people selling pigs who all compete on prices. His dream is to remain healthy so he can carry on working and build a house. In his free time Julio enjoys going for walks with his parents.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Julia; tiene 40 años de edad,  la socia es viuda; la socia tiene 4 hijos  de 20, 17, 7, 2 años de edad; La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia se dedica a  comprar al por mayor golosinas y a la distribución de viandas en las diferentes obras, la socia trabaja en dos actividades, ella por un lado en las tardes se dedica  a la venta de golosinas de forma independiente no contando con una carreta autorizada, ella en una caja de cartón acomoda las diferentes golosina y jalando otra canasta regular , lleva otro grupo de galletas y chocolates. La socia también muy temprano por la mañana se dedica a elaborar los diferentes almuerzos diarios en viandas de plástico y las lleva a las diferentes obras en las cuales encuentra a los trabajadores muy ocupados construyendo casa, edificios, colegios y otros y ofrece los servicios de llevarles como 20 a 30 almuerzos diarios a las misma hora, lo cual es ventajoso para estos señores y rentable para la socia, ella desea en esta ocasión poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus viandas, ella compraría aceite en bidones, papas al por mayor, arroz en sacos, y otros productos  más, la socia no tiene planes a futuro solo el poder seguir teniendo trabajo y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, ella solo desea que sus hijos tengan comida diaria, salud, vestido y que se puedan educar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor como aceite, papa entre otros.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Solidaridad-Cachimayo Community Bank located in the district of Cachimayo, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. She is 40 years old and a widow. She has four children aged 20, 17, 7, and 2. 

Julia has two jobs. The first is a business selling candy. She buys it wholesale and then sells it at different work sites. She does this in the afternoons independently, not from an authorized cart. In a cardboard box she places different kinds of candy, and in a basket she puts cookies and chocolate. 

Her other job is making lunches. She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the food and then takes the plastic containers to different work sites where busy workers are building houses, buildings, schools etc. She sells 20-30 lunches daily at a set time. This is an advantage for the men, and profitable for Julia.

Now Julia wishes to buy ingredients for making the food. She is seeking a loan to buy oil in cans, potatoes at wholesale prices, rice in sacks, and other products. She doesn't have any special plans for the future, only to be in work and able to pay for her children's needs. Her only wish is for her children to have regular meals, health, clothing, and an education.

Julia is grateful for the support that is offered and promises to make the loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale, such as oil and potatoes, for her lunch-making business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Cachimayo, en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Victoria; tiene 58 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene a sus hijos ya todos independientes;  La socia  se encarga D. llevar en viandas a las diferentes obras donD. previamente ella ofreció sus servicios D. alimentación desayunos consistentes en un plato D. segundo  como lomo saltado y otros, después un vaso D. jugo D. papaya u otro, una taza D. café o mates, y un pan D. la región, este es el desayuno clásico en la sierra sur del país, la socia ofrece este servicio por la suma D. 4 soles, la socia  hace las compras y muy temprano se dedica  a la elaboración D. las diferentes  viandas, la socia lleva los desayunos en taperes o viandas a las obras y los reparte a ella le pagan mensualmente, por lo que requiere comprar los productos  para la elaboración D. los platos a cocinar diarios, ella compraría papa, arroz, aceite, sal y otros productos al por mayor, la socia comenta que este trabajo es rentable por lo que por ahora ella está muy entusiasmada del modo que es. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. productos para la elaboración D. los diferentes potajes.
	
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” [Cachimayo Solidarity] communal bank. The bank is located in the District of Cachimayo, in the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Victoria, and she is 58 years old and married. All of her children are already independent. The borrower works taking food to various work sites where she has previously offered her services. She provides breakfasts consisting of a main course such as fried beef or other dish, followed by a glass of papaya juice or other juice, a cup of coffee or herbal tea, and some local bread. This is the classic breakfast in the southern mountainous region of the country. The borrower offers this service for the sum of 4 Peruvian soles. She makes her purchases, and very early she starts preparing the various dishes. She takes the breakfasts in containers or dishes to the work sites and distributes them. She is paid monthly, and she needs to buy supplies to prepare the dishes she makes every day. She would like to buy potatoes, rice, oil, salt and other products on a wholesale basis. The borrower comments that this work is profitable, and because of this, for now she is very enthusiastic about the way it is going. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying supplies to prepare various dishes.
	
The borrower is grateful for the help which will be provided to her, and accordingly, she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make various dishes.

loans.name: Angel Fausto

texts.es:
Angel Fausto tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Angel se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha.  Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir cultivando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de Paseo a Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Angel Fausto, 50, is single and has no children.  He lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province.

The communal bank "El Placer" is located in the canton of Chillanes in San Jose del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the offices of Cooperativa San Jose.  In this communal bank there are 24 members who are farmers cultivating bananas, rice, cassava, cocoa, soy and oranges, and also members who raise barnyard animals.  

Angel is a farmer who cultivates rice, corn, oranges, soybeans and bananas.  He makes his purchases in San Jose del Tambo, and he sells his products in the Chillanes market on Sundays at the fair.

He requests a loan to buy farming supplies.  This loan will help him to have a better harvest.  His dream is to buy land so that he can continue to farm.  

In his free time he likes to go to Guayaquil.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Carmen Fiorella

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Carmen; tiene 25 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad ; La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia se dedica  al compra al por mayor de cuyes y luego los vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, la socia también trae  a la ciudad del Cusco a vender en los restaurantes turísticos, el cuy es protagonista de tener una de las mejores carnes con o colesterol y el consumo en la zona sur es de un 80 5; la socia conocedora de las bondades de tan rico potaje cría más de 3 años con sus familia cuyes y en esta ocasión ella lleva independientemente con un numero de 200 cuyes, la socia vendió el mes pasado 100 cuyes y ahora de sea incrementar su corral y comprar 100 cuyes mas para la crianza, la socia también comprar el alimento para los primeras dos semanas para todos los cuyes, la socia desea a futuro hacer su restaurante y dedicarse a la atención y preparación de los potajes en base a cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes en un total de 100.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” which is located in the District of Cachimayo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a seven-year-old son. Carmen is a small merchant who buys guinea pigs in bulk and sells them to different restaurants in the area. She also brings the animals to the city of Cusco to sell to the tourist restaurants. Guinea pigs are known for having one the best types of meat because it is low in cholesterol. The consumption rate of guinea pig in the southern area is 80%. Carmen knows that this meat is good for making rich stews since she has been raising these animals for more than three years. She currently has 200 guinea pigs. Last month, she sold 100 guinea pigs and wants to expand her pens so that she can buy 100 more to raise. Carmen also wants to buy enough feed to last two weeks for all of her guinea pigs. In the future, she wants to open a restaurant where she can prepare and serve stews made from the guinea pig. Carmen is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of 100 guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy 100 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Josefa; tiene 47 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 23, 21, 20 años de edad;  La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia compra animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral,  los cuales los engorda, procrean y los vende, ella tiene a sus gallinas ya listas para la venta son 60  gallinas que deben ser vendidas en el transcurso de esta semana, por lo que necesitara la compra de nuevas aves de corral en un numero de 100 y también comprara cuyes, la socia requiere comprar 100 cuyes también para la crianza, reproducción si se da satisfactoriamente y la venta final. La socia desea tener en un futuro cercano su granja de animales menores.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes y pollos.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” which is located in the District of Cachimayo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 23, 21, and 20). Josefa is a small merchant who buys domesticated animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens for fattening, breeding, and resale. She prepares her chickens for sale and sell as many as 60 over the course of a week. For this reason, she needs to acquire 100 new birds and also buy guinea pigs. Josefa is looking to buy 100 guinea pigs to raise and successfully breed so that they can be eventually sold. In the near future, she hopes to have a farm for her animals. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens.

Josefa is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS” iniciará su décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Maria Luisa es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de cajas, comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora María Luisa,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de cajas de tomate que viene trabajando hace cuatro años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus familias.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de la las barracas y posterior a la elaboración de lo entregará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Rosas” (The Roses) is starting its 11th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Maria Luisa serves as its treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different types of businesses to get ahead such as manufacturing crates, retail shops, production, and services.

Sra. Maria Luisa says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one year. She joined the organization after being invited by a local promoter. At the moment, she has a business that manufactures tomato crates. She has been involved in this type of work for four years and learned the trade from her relatives.

This loan will be used to increase her capital for purchasing wood. She acquires the wood from the lumber yards and manufactures her products according to order. Working this manner has enabled her to generate income to support her family. Maria Luisa is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria Luisa said that she enjoys the savings and the training classes.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making crates.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene un pequeño salón para  fiestas infantiles. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de juegos infantiles, como un resbalin inflable, un trampolín, vajilla, algunas mesas y sillas y un amplificador para ofrecer mejor servicio en su negocio. Vive en casa de sus padres   la misma queda ubicada en la zona Vino Tinto en la ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que la señora tiene un crédito en nuestra institución y  en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes has a small facility that is used for children’s parties. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy children’s games, an inflatable slide, a trampoline, as well as dishes, some tables and chairs, and an amplifier so that she can provide better service in her business. Lourdes lives at the home of her parents in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. She is a single mother and has one child.

This is the first time she has received a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase games, an inflatable slide, a trampoline, dishes, tables, chairs, and an amplifier to use for children's parties.

loans.name: Yonny Claudio

texts.es:
Yonny Claudio tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijos vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Yonny  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano y a la cria de chanchos. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y alimentacion para los chanchos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y los animales. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia y vivir con los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a jugar pelota con los vecinos.
texts.en:
Yonny Claudio is 43 years old, single, and has two children. He lives by himself in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank called “El Placer” is part of the canton of Chillanes and in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of 24 members who are farmers. They grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soybeans, and oranges. In addition, they raise domesticated animals.

Yonny grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. He also raises pigs. Yonny purchases his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his products at the market in Chillanes and at the fair on Sundays.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies and feed for his pigs. This money will help him improve his crops and his animals. Yonny does not face any major challenges. His dream is to have a house of his own where he can live with his children.

In his free time, Yonny enjoys playing ball with the neighbors.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Yonny Capri

texts.es:
Yonny Capri tiene 45 años de edad, es casado tiene tres hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Yonny  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha . No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es poder seguir educando a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los vecinos y los amigos.
texts.en:
Yonny Capri is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank called “El Placer” is part of the canton of Chillanes and in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of 24 members who are farmers. They grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soybeans, and oranges. In addition, they raise domesticated animals.

Yonny grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. He purchases his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his products at the market in Chillanes and at the fair on Sundays.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies. This money will help him improve his crops. Yonny does not face any major challenges. His dream is to continue providing an education for his children.

In his free time, Yonny enjoys placing sports with neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia, tiene un punto Internet y cabinas telefónicas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de golosinas (dulces); así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes cuando estén usando Internet y generar ingresos extras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí  en la ciudad de La Paz; es madre soltera y tiene una hija. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Alicia has an Internet café and phone booths. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy that she can sell to her customers while they are using the Internet. This will help her generate extra income. Alicia lives in her own home in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz. She is a single mother and has one daughter.

This is the third time her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to purchase candy that she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre has been an artisan all his life. He had his own crafts workshop in his native Congo before moving to the US as a refugee in 2007. After almost three years of working with a non-profit that produced and commercialized African crafts, he decided to start his own business. Jean Pierre uses his connections with African artisans living in the US to purchase crafts, but he also buys products from Africa whenever he can purchase in bulk. He resells all the crafts at fairs and shows in his area. These shows take place during the weekends, which enables him to keep his full-time job. Certain shows and larger clients require more business formality, which in the industry translates into websites and product portfolios. Jean Pierre hopes to open a big crafts store in the United States some day.

Jean Pierre wants a loan to set up a business website to expand his clientele and to be able to sell during the weekdays. The remainder of the loan proceeds will go to make bulk purchases.

loans.use: To set up a business website and buy more inventory

loans.name: Tamufor

texts.en:
He was born in June 1967 and is married with seven kids. Three of these children are under fifteen years of age. He lives with his family in a two-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. The major challenges he has faced in life have been the death of his father, the failure of his son in the ordinary-level Government Certificate Exams, the difficulty to pay his children’s school fees and the sudden death of two of his pigs.
 
He joined GHAPE in 2009. He invested his last loan in his pig business and used the proceeds to educate his children and to buy zinc and nails to complete his house. He plans to invest this loan in his electronics shop, to buy cables, bulbs and plugs. He believes that this business will be successful because he is selling very good quality cables and other materials that his customers will like.

With the proceeds from this loan, he will pay his children’s school fees and furnish his house. He prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, the education GHAPE offers its members, and because the loan is repaid in payments.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cables, sockets and electric tools.

loans.name: Celso David

texts.es:
Celso David tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero tiene un hijo vive  solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Celso David  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia para vivir con el hijo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Celso David is 33 years old, single, and has one child. He lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank called “El Placer” is part of the canton of Chillanes and in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of 24 members who are farmers. They grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soybeans, and oranges. In addition, they raise domesticated animals.

Celso David grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. He purchases his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his products at the market in Chillanes and at the fair on Sundays.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies and fertilizers. This money will help him improve his crops. Celso David does not face any major challenges. His dream is to own a house where he can live with his son.

In his free time, Celso David enjoys spending time with his son.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jonny Manolo

texts.es: Jonny, es casado de 35 años de edad,y tiene tres hijos,el inicio vendiendo lacteos,pero no le funciono,despues decidio vender por su cuenta plataninas,con un ciento de bolsas para empacar y un ciento de platanos,poco a poco,conforme sus negocio fue creciendo, pudo comprar una moto y contrato a una persona para que le ayudara a vender su producto,actual mente el tiene a 6 personas que le ayudan a elavorar su producto,con el credito que solicito anterior mente,pudo crecer y comprar vitrinas de vidrio para poner en las tiendas su producto,su sueño es crecer y tener un capital mas grande para agrandar mas su ventas y ayudar a su familia para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.el esta solicitando este credito para la copra de platanos para elavorar plataninas.
texts.en:
Jonny is 35 years old and married, with three children.  He started selling dairy products but it didn't workout, so afterwards he decided to sell plantain chips on his own account, starting with 100 bags for packaging and 100 plantains.  Little by little his business has grown, and he has been able to buy a motorbike and hire someone to help him out with selling his product.  Currently he has six people helping him with production.

With his previous loan, he was able to grow and to buy glass display cases to put in the stores for his product.  His dream is to grow and to have greater capital to expand his sales even further and help his family by giving his children a better future.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of plantains for making plantain chips.

loans.use: to buy plantains for making plantain chips.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier, trabaja como mecánico en un taller de reparación de movilidades en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas de trabajo ya que realiza trabajos de mecánica por su cuenta en su tiempo libre y no tiene un taller fijo. Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona de San Juan Cotahuma en la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita ayuda de Kiva para fondeo de este crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Javier works as a mechanic at a vehicle repair shop in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools for his work. He performs repair jobs in his spare time and does not have a permanent workshop. Javier lives at home with his parents in the District of San Juan Cotahuma in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the second time that Kiva is being asked to help fund his loan.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Roxana; tiene 30 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad;  La socia  tiene un automóvil el cual lo hace trabajar alquilando a un señor y el presta el servicio de taxi, la socia recibe diario el 70 5 del ingresos que trae el socio de ella y de este modo ella puede generar un ingreso extra a la casa, la socia también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes,  y los cría y vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, la socia también lleva  a Iscuchaka para la venta en la feria del pueblo, ella ahora requiere el préstamo para poder comprar 20 cuyes para aumentar sus galpón o criadero de cuyes, la socia con todos estos ingresos está ahorrando para terminar de construir su casa, ella desea poder dar a su hijo todas las comodidades y terminar de construir su casa y ahorrar para la universidad y los estudios de sus hijo. En cuanto a la crianza de cuyes desea poder seguir comprando más cuyes hasta incrementar el monto y hacer de esto un negocio rentable, crecer y distribuir en los diferentes restaurantes de la ciudad de Cusco, ella está mejorando la raza de sus cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 20 cuyes.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Roxana, 30, is a member of the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) communal bank located in Cachimayo District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and one five-year-old son.  She has a car that she works leasing to a man who provides taxi services.  She gets daily 70% of the income her associate earns and this is a way for her to earn extra income for her home.  She also raises minor livestock like guinea pigs.  She raises them and then sells them to the various local restaurants.  She also goes to Iscuchaka to sell them at the town’s market.

She wants the loan now to buy 20 guinea pigs to expand her guinea pig nursery.  She is using income from all these activities to save up to finish building her house.  She wants to be able to give her son all the comforts and to finish building her house and save up for the university and for her son’s schooling.

With respect to the guinea pig raising, she hopes to continue buying more guinea pigs to increase her number and turn this into a profitable business; to grow and sell to various restaurants in the city of Cusco.  She’s improving the breed of her guinea pigs.  

She is requesting the loan to buy 20 guinea pigs.  She is grateful for the support she’ll get and she pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy 20 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Amada Petita

texts.es:
Amanda Petita tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos pero no viven con ella, ella vive sola,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Amanda  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano, ademas cria pollos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes y alimento para los pollos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y la venta de los pollos. Enfreta desafios como la edad y la salud. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a camniar.
texts.en:
Amanda Petita, 60, is single and has two children but they don’t live with her; she lives alone in Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province.

The communal bank is called “El Placer” (Pleasure) and it belongs to Chillanes Canton, San Jose del Tambo Parish, and located 60 minutes from the office.  This communal bank has 24 members who are banana, rice, manioc, cocoa bean, soy and orange farmers; they also raise barnyard animals.

Amanda is a rice, corn, orange, soy and banana farmer; she also raises chickens to sell.  She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and her sales at the Sunday Chillanes market.

She is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies, fertilizer and chicken feed.  The loan will serve as support to improve the crops and the chicken sales.  She faces challenges like age and health.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.  She likes going for walks in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Enih

texts.en:
She was born in 1962. She has four children--only one of them is below fifteen years old. She lives with her family in Azire-Mankon, Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She went through a lot of trauma when she was attacked by armed robbers. She has also suffered ill health which led to an operation. Inadequate capital for her business has also been a major problem for her.

She joint GHAPE in 2008. She has received, and successfully repaid, Empowerment Credit two times. She invested these loans in her retail business where she sold food items like palm oil, garri, and kernel oil. She used the profit from these loans to buy some piglets and also to buy household utensils.

Given a loan, she plans to stock palm oil, garri, and kernel oil and to use some of the money for transportation. She is convinced that this loan will help her succeed because she has all the experience she needs in this line of business. Her activity will be of help to the community because it will reduce the distance people take to get to the market to buy food stuffs.

With the proceeds from this business, she will purchase a piece of land which she will subsequently use as a business site. She will also take care of her family’s needs and save some money for rainy days. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the method of repayment is easier, no collateral is required, and also because of the training GHAPE gives its members.

loans.use: To purchase oil, garri (tapioca), and kernel oil and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Juana; tiene  38 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; y ella tiene 1 hija de 12 años de edad;  la socia  tiene su restaurante, ella atiende su restaurante sola y también se encarga de prepara los diferentes potajes, la socia  tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años y es muy conocida, ella tiene muchos clientes debido a la elaboración de sus potajes, la socia tiene una muy buena sazón lo cual permite que sus clientes le sean fiel, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra al por mayor de arroz, papa, aceite en galón, fideos y otros productos para seguir elaborando sus diversos potajes, ella desea implementar  a futuro su restaurante y mejorar la condición del local. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor, como papa, aceite, arroz y otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, belongs to the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) communal bank located in Cachimayo District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is single and has a 12-year-old daughter.  She has a restaurant that she runs by herself and where she cooks the meals herself.  She’s had this business for four years and is very well known.  She has many customers thanks to the way she prepares her meals; they are very tasty and this leads to her customers being repeat customers.

She wants to invest the loan in wholesale purchases of rice, potatoes, oil by the gallon, noodles and other products to continue preparing her delicious meals. IN the future, she wants to set up a restaurant and improve the conditions of her locale.  She is asking for the loan to buy products, like potatoes, oil, rice and others, at wholesale.  She is grateful for the support that will be provided and she commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Génesis, es del Chaco, está integrado por 11 mujeres de esa zona. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de procurar mayores ingresos y beneficios, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familiares. Se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa, pero les gustaría ir poder creciendo día a día.
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de joyas hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre le piden cierto tipo de joyas. Dice que esto le genera muy buenos ingresos por lo que le gustaría poder seguir en el negocio. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una joyería donde pueda ofrecer la variedad de productos que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pulseras, cadenas, anillos y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Genesis" is made up of 11 women from this area.  They meet with the objective of getting higher incomes and benefits, not only for themselves, but also for their families.  They are in their first loan cycle in the program, but they would like to be able to grow their businesses each day.  Rosa has had a business selling jewelry for a good while now, and she comments that she has a lot of customers who always request a certain type of jewelry.  She says that this business generates good earnings, and so she would like to be able to continue with it.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a jewelry store where she could offer her varied products for sale.

She requests a loan to buy bracelets, chains, rings and other pieces of jewelry, with which she will be able to continue to grow her business and offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She thanks the Fundación for this opportunity, because getting this loan will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains and other pieces of jewelry

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Irene; tiene 44 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos  de 24, 21. 18, 14 años de edad;  La socia tenía antes de este nuevo negocio una tienda escolar, ella no ganaba mucho así que con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar mesas, sillas e implementar el local que tenía para poner un restaurante casero, la socia ahora es dueña de un muy acogedor restaurante en pleno corazón del valle de los incas, la socia se encarga de la elaboración de potajes regionales y esto la hace muy conocida en la zona, ella a futuro desea implementar mejor su restaurante y hacerlo campestre, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos como productos  para elaborar diversos potajes, papa, aceite, sal, arroz, entre otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Irene, 44, belongs to the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) communal bank located in Cachimayo District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She’s married and has four children who are 24, 21, 18 and 14 years old.  Before this business she used to have a school supplies store but she didn’t earn much there so she used her previous loan to buy chairs and tables and turned the locale she had into a restaurant selling home-cooked meals  Now, she owns a very cozy restaurant right in the middle of the Valley of the Incas.  She makes regional dishes and this makes her very well known in the area.  In the future, she’d like to improve her installations and make it into a country inn.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her various dishes like potatoes, oil, salt and rice, among others.

She is grateful for the support that will be provided and she commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 41 años de edad, es casado tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Miguel  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia  para la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la familia a caminar.
texts.en:
Miguel is 41 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes Canton of Bolívar Province .

The "EL PLACER" communal bank in the San Jose del Tambo parish of Chillanes Canton is located 60 minutes from the office. This group has 24 members who are engaged in agriculture, growing bananas, rice, cassava, cocoa, soybeans and oranges, as well as raising livestock.

Michael grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans and bananas. He buys his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his produce in Chillanes market on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers. The loan will provide him the support required to improve his harvest. He does not face any significant challenges. His dream is to have his own home for the family.

In his free time, he likes to go out walking with his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria, es profesora de nivel primario. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que la señora esta estudiando en la noche y por su trabajo no está mucho tiempo en casa, de tal manera que usará la computadora para llevar registros de sus alumnos, tareas, trabajos asignados, etc., y también para sus estudios. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani  en la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera  y no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita que su préstamo vaya a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Hilaria is an elementary school teacher.  She needs the loan to buy a laptop computer.  With going to school at night and her work, she does not have much time at home.  Therefore she will use the computer to keep her students’ records, their homework, and their assignments, etc.  She would also use it for her own studies.

She lives in her parents’ house, which is in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the second time she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to keep her elementary students’ records, their homework, and their assignments, etc.  She would also use it for her own studies.

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
She was born in December 1962. She is married and a mother of six, two of whom are below fifteen years old. She and her family live at mile 90 Nsongwa, a quarter in Bamenda, in the Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Sickness and poverty are the major challenges she has faced in her life.

She joint GHAPE in 2006 and has received, and repaid, Empowerment Credit three times. She intends to invest this loan in her farm and retail business. She will use the loan to buy groundnut, maize seedlings, Rice Beans, firewood and farming tools as well as oil to sell to the final consumers. She believes this business will succeed because she is very hardworking and determined. This business will be of help to the community because it will increase the availability of foodstuffs in her area.

With the proceeds from this loan, she will educate her children, and increase the size of her farm and business. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rates are very low. And the training GHAPE renders to their her clients as well as the social education.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, pay labour and buy parts for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa es artesana y también vende todo tipo de artesanías que trae del departamento de Oruro. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mayor cantidad de artesanías y  así aumentar la mercadería y mejorara sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Villa Exaltación  en la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera  y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que Teresa aplica y obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter de mujer empresaria se lo envia a Kiva para su fondeo.
texts.en:
Teresa is an artisan, and she also sells all types of handicrafts that she gets in the Oruro department.

She needs the loan to buy a greater quantity of handicrafts.  That way she will increase her merchandise and improve her income.

She lives in her own house, which is located the Villa Exaltación zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the first time that Teresa has applied for and received a loan from IMPRO.  Due to her integrity as a businesswoman her request is being sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts in the city of Oruro in order to sell them in the city of La Paz.

loans.name: Tsiagu

texts.en:
Tsiagu is a 30-year-old woman who is married and a mother of three, all of whom are below fifteen years of age. She lives with her family in a two-bedroom house in Ntahbessi, a quarter in Nkwen, in the Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.

Tsiagu is a very committed and hardworking business lady who owns a store in the Nkwen market. Her hard work and commitment have earned her many customers who demand a variety of goods which she cannot stock with her minimal capital. With the help of a loan from GHAPE, she will be able to stock foodstuff like maize, beans, rice and groundnuts which are in high demand. She really believes that this business will be successful because she already has many customers, and has a committed and hardworking spirit.

Her business is helpful to the community because she will increase the variety of goods in the market, making things readily available at moderate prices. She has been through some tough times in her life, such as the death of loved ones, ill health and poverty (which made it difficult to educate her children). 
With the profit from her loan, she will be able to educate her children very well, and to feed, clothe and provide medication for them.

She  prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, and also because of the training the staff offers. The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase groundnuts, beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
L.  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en L. Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
L.  socia Silvia; tiene 39 años de edad,  L. socia es casada; L. socia tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 8 años de edad; L. socia se dedica a L. confección de prendas de vestir  y realiza diversos tejidos,  L. socia requiere el crédito para poder comprar lanas, hilos, botones, telas, para L. realización de sus trabajos como un par de vestidos, un pantalón de varón, dos chompas de lanas para niñas.  L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra de lanas, botones, telas para damas y caballeros.
L.  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the communal bank, "Solidaridad-Cachimayo," which is located in the district of Cachimayo, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Silvia is 39, married, and has 2 children, who are 18 and 8.  She makes clothing and various weavings.  She needs this loan to buy wool, thread, buttons, and fabric to make her clothing, like dresses, men's pants, and two sweaters for girls.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of wool, buttons, and fabric for men's and women's clothing.

She is thankful for the support that is being offered to her, and she promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.
